Al principio alquilaba una moto taxi, pero con esfuerzo y ahorro logro comprarse su propio moto taxi; el desafío que enfrenta Antonio es el vivir solo, lo enfrenta entregándose mucho a su trabajo y permaneciendo ocupado en el. Su sueño es poder comprarse un auto y así poder crecer en el servicio que brinda. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos y en el mantenimiento de la moto taxi. Antonio se encuentra muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Antonio has been a widower for 7 years. He has 2 adult children who are independent. Antonio is dedicated to providing urban transportation service in his 'moto taxi.' He has done this for the last 2 years. 

Antonio chose this type of work because at his age, it seemed to require less physical labor. At the outset, he rented a 'moto taxi', but with effort and savings, it became possible to purchase his own 'moto taxi'.

The challenge Antonio faces is living alone, which he confronts by dedicating himself to his work and staying busy at it. 

His dream is to be able to buy a car and thus, to expand the service he offers. The loan will be invested in buying replacement parts and in the maintenance of his 'moto taxi'.

Antonio is very grateful for the offered opportunity.

loans.use: buy replacement parts and maintenance for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza tiene  43 años D. edad   tiene 1 hijo a cargo,  ella cuenta con casa propia, ella vive con su familia, en un caserío llamado Carrasquillo, en la provincia D. Morropón, en el departamento D. Piura. 

DesD. hace 5 años  Maritza se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc), su negocio lo ha instalado ene su domicilio, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel D. vida.  También cría y venD. animales menores como aves D. corral, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los venD. en mercados D. la zona.

Maritza para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y para cubrir su préstamo.  

Maritza  es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 43 years old and has one child who she cares for. She has her own house. She lives with her family in a hamlet called Carrasquillo, in the province of Morropón, department of Piura. 

Five years ago, Maritza started selling groceries (products that you use daily such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.). Her business is run out of her house and she uses her profits to try to cover all of her expenses and to improve her quality of life. Maritza also raises and sells young animals such as poultry. Once they have grown to an ideal size, she sells them in the nearby markets.

Maritza has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to expand her business. She will buy more merchandise with the sole goal of growing her business and having more products to offer her customers, and to cover her loan.

Maritza is a responsible, dedicated, and hard-working person who is very concerned with helping her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like groceries and staple goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana cuenta con negocio desde hace 5 años denominado  “Mini súper La Escondida•  donde ofrece a sus cliente abarrotes en general como botanas, refrescos. La señora recurre a esta institución para pedir apoyo para surtir su negocio comprando variedad de producto de diversas marcas de buena calidad y así obtener más ganancias para poder sustentar los gastos de su familia. El esposo es un hombre muy responsable con los gastos por ello trabaja para una persona como electricista desde hace 6 años.
texts.en: Juana has had a business called “Minisúper La Escondida” for the last five years where she offers her customers groceries in general like snacks and soft drinks.  She is calling on this institution to ask for help to stock her store buying a variety of products of different, good quality brands to earn more profits to cover her family’s expenses.  Her husband is a very responsible man with respect to expenses and has been working as an electrician for someone for the last six years.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa de 53 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Dora de 50 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación adecuada. Juan, trabaja con mucho esmero sus tierras, cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y achiote, las cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudades de  Quimbiri y San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en tiempos de lluvia por que impiden el avance con su faena programada, por ello con el dinero del crédito solicitado comprará ponchos y botas térmicas para que así pueda protegerse de la humedad y seguir trabajando. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea refaccionar su vivienda. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar su propósito y por ello se compromete ser puntual con sus aportes de pago. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ponchos y botas para todo el miembro de su familia e así trabajar con tranquilidad las épocas de lluvia.
texts.en: Juan, is 53 and lives in Santa Rosa.  He is a hard worker and maintains a house with his wife, Dora, 50 and their four children, who are studying. Juan tends crops such as cacao, coffee and vegetables, which he sells in markets such as Quimbiri and San Francisco, where he has many trusting buyers. He has been farming for 25 years, though seasonal heavy rains are a major obstacle.  For this reason, he seeks this credit to buy rain gear and boots, to allow his family to continue working in the fields despite extreme humidity and heavy rains. He hopes to be able to improve his housing conditions in the future. This is his first credit with MFP, sabe and he is committed to prompt repayment. .

loans.use: to buy rain ponchos and boots to work in the fields

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo  es un señor muy emprendedor a pesar de ser pensionado, el cuenta con su propio  negocio de reparación para automóviles que necesitan alguna compostura a causa de un choque o la pintura que se deteriora a causa del sol.

Su trabajo consiste en resanar la parte afectada y pintar con el color adecuado que el cliente solicite o del mismo color del automóvil. Con este negocio lleva 2 años ofreciendo variedad de precios accesibles para que tenga variedad de clientes, Reynaldo solicita el prestamo para comprar una maquinaria que le facilitaria el trabajo y de esta manera sus ingresos se incrementen.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is an enterprising gentleman even though he is a pensioner.  He has his own business in which he repairs and paints automobiles that have been in accidents or have discolored from exposure to the sun.  

His work involves resurfacing the affected areas and painting an appropriate color based on what the customer requests or the existing color of the automobile.  Reynaldo has been in business for two years and offers a range of affordable prices since he has a variety of customers.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a machine that will facilitate his work and allow him to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to facilitate his work.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel y su esposo el señor Clemente están agradecidos por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos, los cuales les han ayudado a pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos. 
Solicitan un préstamo para poder pagar la inscripción de la escuela de sus hijos y comprar los útiles escolares y uniformes, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar los pagos en la escuela y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando 
Planean pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Doña Maria Isabel de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya que Don Clemente se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como albañil.
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación  necesario para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Isabel and her husband Sr. Clemente are grateful for the assistance they received from their previous loans which were used to pay for their children’s education expenses.

They are requesting another loan to pay for the school tuition of their children and to buy school supplies and uniforms. At the moment, they do not have the necessary funds to pay for school so that their children can continue with their studies.

They plan to repay the loan using the earnings that Doña Maria Isabel receives from her job at a factory. Don Clemente will take care of the family expenses with his salary as a mason. They want their children to have the necessary education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition, school supplies, and uniforms.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 70 years old and married with four children. Three of her children live outsiD. the house and one child still lives with her while she finishes her studies at the Ninda University in Cusco. 

Fortunata is the owner of a small grocery store that sells different kinds of soft drinks, beer, snacks, and household needs. She has had her grocery store for over 30 years. In addition, Fortunata has a small business planning weddings, baptisms, and birthday parties on the weekends. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for the events that she plans because she does not get paid until after she gives the event. She is a very hard-working woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for events she plans such as weddings, baptisms, and birthdays.

loans.name: Francisca Fabiola

texts.es: Francisca Fabiola es madre de una niña de 5 años y un niño de 1 año de edad por los que sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo adquirió su vivienda de interés social, que regularmente estas casas son muy pequeñas el beneficio que tiene la casa  es que tiene suficiente espacio para construir lo cual aprovecho iniciando con ahorros. Es por ello que Fabiola solicito este crédito para terminar la construcción de los detalles como lo es enjarrar, poner ventanas y vitropiso.
texts.en:
Francisca Fabiola is the mother of a five-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son. She wants to get ahead so that she can offer them a better quality of life. Some time ago, Francisca Fabiola acquired her home through a government housing program. These houses are usually very small, but the benefit is that people can purchase them with their savings and have enough space to live in as a starter home.

For this reason, Fabiola is requesting a loan to finish the construction of her house and to add details such as lattice work, windows, and a floor.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 46 años, es un  hombre pasivo y trabajador, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja Fermina de 44 años de edad y sus 03 queridos a quienes le brinda toda su atención. Juan aún cuando era joven trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, pero hace 18 años cuenta con su propia parcela de 03 hectáreas cultivados con plantas de cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación y talleres de manejo de plantas nativas, su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del cacao por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas y desmonte de malezas ya que junio a noviembre son temporadas de ardua cosecha. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera les brinde una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos. Este es su primer crédito, por ello se siente muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que le apoyen en la cosecha y sacar la maleza que crece en sus campos.
texts.en: Juan is 46, calm and hard-working.  He lives in his own house with his wife who is 44 years old, Fermina, and three children. When Juan was young he worked in his father's fields, but 18 years ago he acquired a 3-hectare farm planted in cacao and coffee.  His success stems from his creativity and hard work, and he has benefitted from technical training as well.  Cacao is his most sought-after crop, for the high quality he produces, and generates strong profits.  Juan generally works alone, but in times of harvest he hires day laborers on the farm to gather ripe fruit.  He plans to use this credit to hire workers in the June to November harvest period, allowing him to expand production and better his family's prospects. This is his first credit, and with the 3,000 nuevos soles he will hire workers to clear the fields and bring in the harvest.

loans.use: to pay farm workers

loans.name: Flamboyan Group

texts.en:
The Flamboyan group is made up of 11 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of Rp.16,500,000 and each member will receive Rp.1,500,000.  The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising.  This is their fourth loan with MUK.

Ni Made is the head of the Flamboyan group.  She used the loan to buy three piglets and pig feed. She is married. Her husband earns money as a blacksmith. Ni Made would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months when they have been fattened.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Judith Erlinda

texts.es:
Judith con su credikiva anterior comprò bolsos, mochilas y artesanias que vendiò y obtuvo un poco aumento en su capital de trabajo. Con su nuevo credikiva  repetirá su compra. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio hasta lograr su completa formalizacion; Ella està muya agradecida está por el apoyo que le dieron los financiadores de Kiva para continuar trabajando y en consecuencia dice "yo responderé con mi pago puntual.
Si usted quiere leer la historia de Judith ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/219028
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Judith was able to buy bags, backpacks, and handcrafted items to sell, as well as increase slightly her operating capital. This new Kiva loan will allow her to buy the same items. Her dream is to grow her business until it is formally complete. Judith is very grateful for the support from Kiva lenders so that she can continue working. She says, “I have responded by making my payments on time.”

To learn more about Judith’s story, please follow the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/219028

loans.use: to purchase bags, backpacks, and handcrafted items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 53 años, es natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, vive en su propia casa en el poblado de Machente junto a su pareja Mauro de 39 años y sus 03 queridos hijos quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente. María vive en las verdes praderas de su centro poblado, fuera de la contaminación de la ciudad que la mantienen con gran vitalidad para trabajar con más ahínco sus tierras, ella cultiva plantas nativas de la zona selvática, tales como: café y frutas cítricas productos que logró trabajarlos con mucha entrega para volverlos muy fructíferas. María viene labrando sus tierras desde sus 20 años y hoy es toda una conocedora de la ardua labor que se ejerce en el campo. En tiempos de cosecha y traslado de productos ella necesariamente tiene que contratar peones para apresurar su trabajo. A María le gusta su trabajo por que gracias a ello compró una piara de cerdos así obteniendo doble ingreso económico. María solicita el crédito para fortalecer sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas  razón por la cual acude a los prestamos que MFP facilita y con el préstamo solicitado comprará sacos de abono ya que con ellos sus plantas lucirán mas frondosos. Este será su 16avo crédito por la cual se siente muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo por parte de ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: María is 53 and lives in her own home in Machente, Santa Rosa, with her husband Mauro and three children, who are her inspiration. María lives in the green plains far from the pollution of urban centers.  She tends crops such as coffee and citrus fruits, which require much care. María has worked her fields for 20 years and has gained much farming knowledge as a result.  During harvest and to bring products to market, she hires farm laborers. Maria recently also bought two pigs to raise, which greatly increased her revenues.  Maria now seeks this credit from MFP to buy fertiziler to increase her crop yield.  This is her 16th loan, and she is committed to prompt repayment.  The 3,000 nuevos soles will go directly to cover costs of fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer to increase crop yield

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa tiene ya más de 23 años dedicándose a la venta de muebles para el hogar. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en comprar más muebles más modernos ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión y sus clientes le están solicitando varios tipos de muebles. No cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir. 
Doña Maria Teresa planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá con la inversión, ya que su esposo el señor Benedicto se encargara de los gastos familiares.
Desea mejorar la inversión de su negocio y de su familia, también quiere contratar a dos personas para darles trabajo en las ventas y así ayudarlos económicamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Teresa already has more than 23 years of experience selling household furniture. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more modern furniture, but she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment. Her customers are requesting all types of furniture, but she does not have the necessary capital for this investment.

Doña Maria Teresa plans to repay the loan using the profits she earns from this investment. Her husband Sr. Benedicto takes care of the family expenses.

Maria Teresa wants to improve the investment in her business and in her family. She also wants to hire two employees so that she can give them sales jobs and help them financially.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell.

loans.name: Nora Hilda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nora le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita que es cemento, pintura y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica, ya es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que estén más seguros y así poder evitar enfermedades por la humedad.
texts.en:
Nora's house is lacking the finishing touches on its exterior.  She requests a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs such as cement and paint, and so that she can hire a person to do this work.  She plans to pay off the loan with part of the earnings she obtains from her work in a factory.  She is a single mother with 2 children in her care.

She wants to improve the family's property and make it more secure, and in this way avoid the illnesses that can occur when moisture seeps into a house.

loans.use: to do finishing work on the exterior of her house

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs.Chhum, 59, lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Her husband is 67 years old. Both of them are farmer. They have nine kids. Some of them are working and get a suitable salary per month and give some money to their parents every month. Three of the nine are married. 

To increase her earnings and have a comfortable standard of living, Mrs.Chhum wishes to borrow the amount of $175 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Mrs. Hok, age 47, is a farmer who lives in Kompong Speu Province. She has many years experience in farming business with her husband. They have six children, three of whom are single and three of whom are already married.  Her children provide important support for her famiL..  Two work in a garment factory, and one works as a taxi driver. He has difficulty getting business as he does not have a drivers' license.  She would like to borrow funds from Kiva in order to help her son secure a license so that he can earn more income to contribute to her famiL..  She will use the remainder of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other materials. She is pictured here with her husband.

loans.use: to make the driving license for son and also buy seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Speu, Mrs. Sim has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has five kids, two of whom are single and three married. Two of them are employed in a garment factory as workers. Her husband works in the fields frequently alongside her. Mrs. Sim and her husband are seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding. They will sell the offspring and increase the income of their family.  Note : Mrs. Sim and her husband take a picture under their house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children, three of whom are in school. For the past five years, Maria has been a vegetable farmer. She has sustained her business with 11 previous loans from NWTF.

Maria is requesting a 24,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and farm supplies

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Bo is 65 years old and lives with her husband in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Her husband is also 65 years old. Both of them are farmers and they have four adult children. All of their kids are working for suitable salaries and are able to provide for their parents and also for their individual families. 

Bo is requesting a 250 USD loan to repair her house and improve her living standard and increase her comfort. She appears in this photo with her husband.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en: The Putri Mandiri group resides in Banjar Village, Pancardawa Pendem Village, west Bali. Their goal in joining a group is to facilitate obtaining a loan that will be used to raise pigs and to be trained the right way to raise pigs. Each members gets Rp 1,500,000 to buy piglets. Ni Ketut use the loan to buy four piglets. Now the price of piglets is very expensive. The price per piglet is Rp. 450,000 so the cost of Rp 1,800,000 for the rest have been taken from the last profits. Ni Ketut and all the members of Puteri Mandiri hope the loan can help to increase their businesses.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Melitina

texts.en:
Melitina is unmarried at the age of 38 years-old and lives in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Melitina sells canned goods and other daily needs products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products for her store such as noodles, canned goods, etc. 

Melitina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for one month. In the future, Melitina hope to make her sari-sari store bigger and more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase goods and other products for her store such as noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en:
Prudencio is 56 years old and married with six school-age children. Someday, Prudencio hopes to give all his children the education they need for a brighter future. As a farmer working in the Philippines, he earns the average net income of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each cropping season in April and November. 

Prudencio has been growing rice for almost 30 years now. Farming has been the only business his family has to battle against poverty. He is asking for a loan to pay the labor fees for preparing his land and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his faming. This loan will allow Prudencio to increase his rice production.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees used in his land preparation and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farming.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech, 36, lives in Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia where she sells mixed products in a market near her village, earning about $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning as much as $5 per day. Pech would like to borrow $375 to purchase more mixed goods.

loans.use: to purchase more mixed goods to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 24 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is only 7 years old. Angelita is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice and vegetables to sell. Angelita also buys vegetables from other farmers. She goes to nearby towns to sell her products. Angelita works hard to support her family.

Angelita has requested a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. She hopes to be able to save for her children's education. She also hopes to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sarng

texts.en: Mrs. Sarng is a rice planter in Ornlong Veng.  From her farming business, she can make around $2 a profit for use in daily expenses. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. Her husband always uses his old motorbike to pick up passengers who need to go anywhere around their community. Unfortunately, his motorbike often breaks down while he is transporting customers and it is hurting his business.  Because of that, Mrs. Sarng has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to repair her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to fix her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest is 7. Bernaditha's husband works as a farmer. Bernaditha is a food vendor. She makes rice cakes, banana cue and other local delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. She also has a small store where she sells soft drinks and vinegar. Bernaditha also helps work on the farm when she can.

Bernaditha is requesting a loan to buy farm fertilizers and ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas. She hopes to be able to send all her children to school and have them finish college.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers and ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, hybrid seeds of rice and herbicide for her farming.

loans.name: Etheljen

texts.en:
Etheljen is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Etheljen has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled plastics and bottles. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional recyclable products and junk to sell.

Etheljen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Etheljen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional recyclable products and junk to sell.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Charlita has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Charlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Mary has a water refilling station that sells and refills drinking water. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to pay for the utilities spent during delivery of water containers.

Mary is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the utilities spent during delivery of water containers.

loans.name: Toeuy

texts.en: Aged only 16, Mrs. Toeuy is married to a husband who stays in the village like she does. Her husband is 27 years old. At present both of them are farmers. They can earn about $4 per day to support themselves. They don't have any children at present. Living with her husband from day to day, Mrs. Toeuy wishes to expand her farming business and make it better than before. She would like to borrow the amount of $300  to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita sells banana cue and other snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. Normelita is married with five children. She has requested a loan to buy raw ingredients.

Normelita has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, Normelita hopes to educate her children until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks such as oil, sugar, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Zenaida has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

Zenaida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juditha has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Juditha is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juditha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that sells detergents, snacks & noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is now 57 years old and married. She is engaged in farming to create income for her family. In farming, she earned an average net income of PHP 40,000 in the previous cropping season. In the future, Adelaida hopes to earn consistent profits from farming to make her family more economically stable.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such fertilizers and to pay for labor fees for the people she hired to till, sow, pull and transplant her rice crop in the field. She has been doing this type of work for 25 years already.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such fertilizer and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Supporting a family is a big responsibility for parents. This is a large family that has nine children. Five of them are married and live separately from their parents. Four of the nine are single. Some of the kids are studying at primary school and secondary school also.

Presently Mrs. Chea is a cake seller at a school. As for her husband, he is a farmer. Both of them can earn perhaps $5 per day. To allow her big family to live in comfort as rich people in her community, Mrs. Chea wishes to borrow the amount of $500 to raise chickens.

loans.use: to raise chickens.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 51 years old and married with seven children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Felicisima is a farmer. She has been growing seaweed for 10 years. She also runs a small sari-sari store business. Felicisima is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, nylon, straw and other materials.

In the future, Felicisima hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, nylon, straw and other materials

loans.name: Pedrosa

texts.en:
Pedrosa is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Pedrosa has a bakeshop that sells different kinds of bread & pastries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making breads & pastries.

Pedrosa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pedrosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making bread & pastries

loans.name: Theam

texts.en:
We know that the field as farming business is the one business where it is veR. hard to earn enough income to support the family comfortably as others. Mrs.Theam and her husband tR. eveR. day to work hard to feed all their children. Both of them work as farmers. They can earn about $4 per day. They are raising four children; three of them are studying at school and one of them helps the parents to do farming. All of them are single. 

To create a big family in prosperity and modern as others, Mrs.Theam would like to borrow the amount of $375 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elvisa has a retail shop that sells snacks, biscuits, breads & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Elvisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela sells clothes and sweaters to financially support her husband. She is a very hard-working lady who tries to provide full support to her husband financially with her business. Her husband is an electrician by profession and offers electricA. repair services as well as sells electric items like tube lights and bulbs, etc. 

Nabeela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy new electricA. repair tools & electric items to improve his business and provide better electricity services to his customers. Nabeela is hopeful that by providing the loan to her husband, he will be able to do his business better and increase his income. He is very experienced in his business and Nabeela has full confidence in him.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With the previous loan, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools & electric items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey is a 30 year-old married woman with two kids who are attending public school. She earns a daily income by selling different kinds of wooden statues.  She typically makes a profit of approximately $3 each day. Mrs. Mey’s husband works as a driver and is earning an income of $3 per day. Mrs. Mey’s husband wants to independently run a motor taxi service, but he lacks capital to purchase his own motorcycle. To solve this situation, Mrs. Mey and her husband are asking for a loan of $500 that they will pool with their personal saving to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has had a sari sari store business for 7 years. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee and other various items. She usually earns about 6000 PHP per month with her business.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, rice, coffee and canned goods. Gloria hopes to have a bigger store in the future. She hopes to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, rice, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Voun

texts.en:
We know that the farming business is one business where it is very hard to earn enough income to support a family as well as others. But Mrs. Voun and her husband try to work hard every day to feed their children and provide good living standards. Both of them work as farmers. They can earn about $4 per day. They are raising two children. 

To create a small family in prosperity and modern as others, Mrs. Voun and her husband would like to borrow the amount of $750 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 43-year-old married woman with 9 children. The oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is only 3 years old.

Letecia and her husband are both farmers. They own and till a land in Trinidad, Bohol. They basically grow rice crops to sell. Letecia works hard to support her family. She said it is not very easy since they have a big family.

Letecia requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Letecia hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.en:
Kanybek is a 56-year-old villager who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. In 1991, Kanybek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

As Kanybek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, he started this activity with great enthusiasm. He used his initial capital of 25,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening and reselling and managed to increase the number with the monthly income of 10.000 KGS. Also, he began to cultivate a special type of potatoes, which became a very profitable business. 

Now Kanybek plans to use this loan of 130,000 KGS to buy a bull calf and sheep to fatten and resell. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to reconstruct his barn in order to provide good conditions for his cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf and sheep to fatten.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a widow with a 23-year-old child. She is 53 years old and has had a sari sari store business for 4 years.

Norma sells items like soft drinks, canned goods and vinegar. She also sells rice to the people in her community. She usually earns about 6000 PHP per month with her business. Norma also raises pigs to sell.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods. Norma hopes to have a bigger store and piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Her husband is involved in the construction supplies business. He has a good number of business contacts who come to buy construction supplies from him due to the good quality of the items he sells. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of his customers and earns better profits. 

Rani is a housewife and takes care of her family by staying at home. She manages her household responsibilities and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further after making the loan investment into it.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Anavil

texts.en:
41-year-old Anavil earns a living through farming. She has a 10-year-old child. Anavil hires a few laborers from her town to help till her land. She grows rice crops to sell. Anavil works hard to send her child to school and to improve their living conditions.

Anavil has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers she hired to help till her farm. Anavil hopes to reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 44 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 14.

Bernadeth has been engaged in farming for 8 years. She and her husband own and till land in Banga, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow at their farm. Bernadeth does her best to keep their farm productive because it is her family’s main source of income.

Bernadeth has requested a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 56-year-old rice farmer who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has three children aged 17, 22 and 24. Edna’s husband is also a farmer.

Edna dreams of having better living conditions for her family. She also desires to see her children have bright futures. Edna works hard to achieve her dreams for her family. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops. She also applied for a loan to buy the farm supplies they need. She will buy additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. Edna is hopeful that this loan will help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en: The pig business performed by Ni Ketut arguably is quite good in terms of income. The continued lending from MUK of Rp. 1,300,000 is expected to further develop the pig business. She will use the loan to buy four piglets. Entering the age of 29 years, Ni Ketut is encouraged to more actively expand her business, which had previously only received a net gain of Rp. 150,000 per month from the sale of two fattened pigs. And the result will certainly be used to help her husband's income as a farmer to meet the needs of the family and their children's school fees. In addition, it will also help to increase business capital for the pigs. The Sari Usaha group, led by Ni Ketut is greatly helped by loans from MUK.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: Bismillah's Group

texts.en:
Bismillah is 44 years of age, married and has four children. Her husband is involved in the milk selling business. For this reason, he has kept some buffalos. Two of her children work in a factory and the other two are studying.  She is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. In her spare time, she offers full support to her husband by milking the buffalo and taking care of them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get more milk and increase his sales and profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 12 years. Bismillah hopes that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will not only grow but it will also allow him to buy an asset for his business. She is a new loan applicant and very confident about the better financial future of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bismillah.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for baby clothing to sell

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is 35 years of age and married. Her husband is a laborer by profession. She is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is also a laborer.  Her remaining two children stay at home. Due to financial reasons, she couldn’t educate her children. 

Shaheen is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well. She also has a buffalo at home. She sells its milk to her community clients. She is very fair in her rates and has a good number of clients in her area due to the quality of milk she provides to them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo, which will allow her to sell a larger quantity of milk and increase her profits. She hopes that after the loan investment, her business will grow and increase her income, which will allow her family to have a better standard of living. 
 
She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sat is the leader of this group of three women living in Kompong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Sat is 41 years old and married.  The couple has given birth of five kids and currently lives with three single children while the other two are married already. She earns a living by planting rice on her own farmland. She can plant her rice crop twice a year following rainy season and dry season. She would like to plant now, before the coming rainy season, which is good for her crop.  Mrs. Sat would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer. With the remaining funds, she will buy some piglets which she will raise for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop growing well and to buy some piglets to feeding.

loans.name: Pasar Lontar Group

texts.en:
Enung is 42 years old and is married with 4 children.  Her business is selling childrens toys.  She start her business in 1987.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for children's toys like cars, rackets and congklaks. 

Until now her business has been running well.  She wants to expand her business in Pasar Lontar, Cilincing.  She hopes she can educate her children until university by continuing to do this business.

loans.use: to buy children's toys like a cars, rackets and congklaks for sale in her children's toy store

loans.name: Rachelle Ann

texts.en:
Rachelle is 24 years old and is married.  She operates a "sari sari store" (which is the common name for a variety store) in their village where she sells canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other spices.  She has had this business for five months already. 

Rachelle earns PHP 2,000 in the business each week and this income put back into the operation of her business so it will be maintained and eventually grow for her family needs.  She is asking a loan amount of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of goods like coffee, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks for the store to attract more costumers to their place to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods like coffee, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks for the store

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is 51 years old and was a married woman with adult age children.  In her general store, she sells basic goods to customers like toothpaste, shampoo, detergent and some fast food.  She has had this business for eight years now earning an average net income of PHP 4,000 each month.

To buy more products to retail in her store such as canned goods, various spices, soft drinks and candies, Arcely is asking to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to retail in her store such as canned goods, various spices, soft drinks and candies,

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Like most farmers in his town, he grows rice because it’s the basic food of Filipinos and easier to sell. Eduardo has been a rice farmer for 10 years. He works hard to keep his crops healthy.

Eduardo is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is in rice farming and hog-raising businesses. She is 45 years old and is a married woman with two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Juvy helps her husband till their land located in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops and vegetables. They also own a "carabao" (water buffalo) that helps in tilling the land. Juvy raises her pigs in their backyard. She sells the pigs at the market.

Juvy is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pigs. She hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children’s college education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a skillful lady who does sewing for her neighboring clients. She receives regular orders and makes good profits every month from her skills. She is 30 years old and has three children. All of them are very young and studying. 

Her husband works in a factory. His income is not enough for the whole family that’s why Nasreen decided to support him financially with her sewing business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business sewing clothes. With the loan, she will buy an electric sewing machine that will allow her to finish her orders quicker and earn better profits. She is very much experienced in her work and has been operating her business for the last three years. She is confident that an investment will bring even better profits to her and help her family to live a better financial life. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is very responsible client and has established a good credit behavior in the previous loan year.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old, married and has five children. She has had a piggery business for 25 years now, earning an average net income of Php 4,000 after four months of raising her pigs. 

She is hoping to improve her income in the business so she wants to take out a loan amount of Php 6,000 to sufficiently supply feed and vaccines for her pigs. At her retirement age, Teresita is hoping that she can save a small amount of her business income in the upcoming four months for emergencies.

loans.use: to sufficiently supply feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 58 years old and is a married woman with seven children. She and her husband are both farmers. They own and till a plot of land in Banga, South Cotabato where they also live. Rice is the main crop that they grow at their farm.

Marianita applied for a loan because as she said, they need additional farm inputs but they don’t have the capability to buy what they need. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

In the future, Marianita hopes to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 42 years old, married and has two children. His biggest dream in life is to see his children finish their education and become professionals someday. Because of that, Jerry is working hard in farming to ensure his income. Along with him is his wife who serves as his partner in the business.
 
He has been 22 years in rice farming and usually, he earns Php 25,000 per harvest season (twice a year). He plans to increase his yield by applying exact amounts of fertilizers, spraying insecticides to avoid pests and applying herbicides to avoid growth of weeds for a better yield.

Jerry is requesting a loan amount of Php 27,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and rice seeds. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his practices in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and rice seed.

loans.name: Estrella Group

texts.en:
Estrella is married with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in La Libertad.

Estrella runs a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Estrella joined PMPC just this year. Estrella is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lontar Indah Group

texts.en: Sri is married and has four children. She is 46 years old. Her business is selling electronic goods according to orders. She wants to borrow 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah because she wants to add clothing to her merchandise. With her business she can help financial problems in her family. She hopes she can continue this business on a larger scale and help her family to improve their financial condition.

loans.use: to pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed operates a grocery store with her husband. Their store is adjacent to their home and they divide their duties. In their grocery store, they sell daily use items such as sugar, spices, and cooking oil, etc. 

Khursheed is the mother of three children. Both of her sons work in a dispensary while her daughter is studying.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of their grocery store business. With the loan, they will buy groceries in bulk for their store which will allow them to fulfill the customers' needs on time and increase their profits.  

She and her husband have been operating this business for the past nine years and hope that their family business will grow better after investing the loan into it.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with two children. She is 57 years old and lives in Ozamis City.

Thelma runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Thelma joined PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 31, is married with two children, aged three and eight. She is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Mary Ann has been growing rice for four years and also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farming supplies. She hopes to be able to send her two children to school and have them finish college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Hassanein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children and lives with two family members who both work.

Hassanein owned a cafeteria since 2010; he prepares popular Iraqi food. He has a long experience in this field and a good reputation and his cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to rebuild the ceiling and to tile the floor for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To rebuild the ceiling and to tile the floor for his shop.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
At 43, Marcelo has been engaged in the rice farming business for 30 years. He is married and has three school-aged children. His wife is his one and only lifetime and business partner in farming and they work to ensure their essential needs.

Marcelo encountered hindrances in generating a large income in farming, such as typhoons, pests and droughts. However, he never loses hope. Instead, he optimistically finds solutions to overcome these problems.

He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy hybrid seeds to grow in his farm. He will also use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

Marcelo is a hard-working father who does everything to sustain his family's needs and to continue sending his children to school. He believes that through his farming, his children will someday become professionals and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds to grow in his farm and to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 38 years of age and single. She lives with her brother. She didn’t want to become a burden to her brother so she started a business sewing clothes. She is very skilful and receives regular orders from customers in her neighborhood as she is known for her good work.
Kalsoom's brother is a jeweler by profession and operates his business from the market. He deals in gold, silver and artificial jewelry. Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to support her brother. With the loan, he will buy artificial jewelry in larger quantities to be able to sell to his customers to make a better profit. He is very experienced in his business and has been working in this area for the past 20 years. Kalsoom is confident that an investment will put his business in a more profitable position.

loans.use: to buy artificial jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has three children.

Hussein has had a store since 2009 selling household items. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a sliding door and a ceiling and to add more inventory to his store. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and a ceiling and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, 61, lives in the Philippines and is widowed with two children. She has a retail shop where she sells snacks, beverages and canned goods, a business she has had for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Supiaty

texts.en:
Supiaty is a 54-year-old widow with five children:

•\tAlberth, 32 years old and married •\tAgustinus, 31 years old and single •\tSerly, 29 years old, a pastor and married •\tPuteri, 18 years old and studying at a University in Surabaya •\tKatty, 17 years old and planning to study at a University in Surabaya

Supiaty is a teacher at an elementary school. Since the death of her husband, Supiaty has been the breadwinner for her family, not an easy task as she works hard to support her children's educational costs and meet their daily needs.

Because her teaching income is insufficient to meet those needs, since 1992 Supiaty has been selling clothes, men's and women's shoes, and women's hand bags to earn additional money. A skilled woman, she also operates a beauty salon offering such services as hair cream baths, hair maskers, hair straightening, and facial and bridal makeup. This business is operated only when she has spare time.

Supiaty plans to improve her business as her daughter Katty will soon be studying in Surabaya for several years. Supiaty is therefore requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase additional stocks of clothes, bags and shoes. She is hoping that TLM will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase business stocks such as clothes, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Selviyanti

texts.en:
Selviyanti, 32, is married to Wellem, 30, and they are both entrepreneurs. From their marriage, they are blessed with two children, Fira, 6, who is in the first grade of elementary school and Ijonk, a one year old baby boy. Since getting married, Selviyanti and family have been living with her parents. Nevertheless, she never relies on her parents to meet her family's daily needs.

Selviyanti runs a kiosk business in order to cover her family's needs. She runs her business with passion and even operates it in two places. From 7am to 1pm, Selviyanti operates her business at a school canteen, located about 3 km from her residence, selling snacks, cakes and beverages. In the afternoon, Selviyanti runs her kiosk, which is located in front of her parent’s house. Sometimes her husband assists her in operating this business.

Selviyanti dreams of expanding her kiosk business but she needs additional capital. She used to be in the TLM lending program for several cycles and has a good repayment record. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR to purchase more stock, such as snacks, beverages, bread, cake and biscuits, as demanded by the students, as well as petrol and kerosene to sell at her kiosk. She hopes TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as snacks, beverages, bread, cake and biscuits.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 25, is married to Joyce. They live in Migori and have four children who are still in school.

Daniel runs a retail shop and has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more sugar, rice, flour and other items to add to his stock. He says that the loan will help him boost his business and in return help him generate more income.

He hopes to be able to open up a general store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and other items to add to his stock.

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
This is Sabelita, 50, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a pastor, and is the mother of three children. By the grace of God, Sabelita has managed to support her older children's schooling up to high school level. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to school, a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Sabelita as she herself is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Sabelita operates a school supplies and accessories stall. She buys school supplies and other items from wholesalers and sells them by the unit for a little profit. Students are attracted to buy given the low selling prices and the many options on offer. Her regular customers are students and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more quantities and varieties of school supplies to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabelita dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share her work stories every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of school supplies and other items for her business.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old and married.

Diyaa has been a tailor since 2004. He makes and repairs men’s clothing. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy  a diesel generator. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is 31 years old, married and has three daughters. She is a very good-natured lady and performs her duties as a housewife and mother very well. All of her daughters are very young and haven’t started their education yet.
Rehana supports her husband in operating a grocery store business. Her husband is also a factory worker and when he goes to work Rehana handles the customers by fulfilling their needs. Rehana and her husband run their store from their home and sell daily household items such as sugar and spices etc. at very reasonable rates.
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy more groceries for his store to achieve greater sales and higher profits. They started this business three years ago and it is working well for them. They hope that an investment will put their business in a more profitable position.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber to add to his business.

loans.name: Adelfina

texts.en:
Adelfina, 25, is a single lady who graduated from senior high school eight years ago. She lives in her own house. Adelfina couldn’t continue her education to university level as her parents could not afford to support her. However, she has never given up because of the condition of her family; she has even been motivated to start a business.

Adelfina initiated a business selling rice when she graduated from high school. She purchases rice in large quantities from local farmers and resells it to retail customers at several traditional markets.

In order to assist her parents, Adelfina also sells solid palm sugar produced by her family. However, this depends on the season because the palm trees only produce liquid once a year, from April to November. 

Adelfina intends to increase her product quantity as rice is the staple food for the community in general. She would like to purchase one ton of rice from the supplier. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 IDR. She is expecting TLM will assist her by providing a loan for the continuity of her business. She believes that she can earn more income to help her parents and to save some money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase one ton of rice.

loans.name: Gayrat

texts.ru: Гайрат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Он более 5 лет занимается животноводством и одновременно торговлей. Гайрат разводит крупнорогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Кроме того он арендует торговую точку на рынке "Панчшанбе". Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Gayrat lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 21 years, single and lives with his parents.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and sales for over five years.  Gayrat breeds cattle for its subsequent resale for meat.  He breeds cattle at his home.  Besides this, he also leases a retail outlet at the "Panchshanbe" market.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred, 41, is from Kisumu city and is a widow. She has five children who are all in school.

Winfred has a grocery business that she has been running for many years. She is currently applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is also a client there. She wants to use the money to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock. She plans to buy land and build her own residential house in the future.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina, who is 51 years old, is a married woman who has four children. Her spouse is a farmer working in the Philippines. They earned the average of PHP 60,000 each crop season during April and November. Their profits were usually used in maintaining their basic needs, paying for their children's schooling and for electric bills and loans.    

Martina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers needed to grow her rice crop. Part of the loan will also be used to pay labor fees in the preparation of her rice field.
 
Someday, Martina hopes to educate all her children to assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Rizalina has a retail shop that sells animal feeds for pigs and chickens. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of animal feeds.

Rizalina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rizalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feeds.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has three children.

Saadi has had a workshop since 2000 for blacksmithing and welding. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1800 loan to buy a welding machine and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Letty has a food shop that sells a variety of viands and green bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell.

Letty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make food to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family.

Mila has been a rice farmer for 20 years. With the income she gets from farming, she is able to feed her family and send her children to school. Mila works hard to keep her farm productive.

Mila requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. She hopes to be able to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32-year-old lady who has two children. Her eldest daughter is in kindergarten while the youngest is only three years old and hasn't started her education yet. 

Bushra and her husband both work as embroiderers and operate their business from their home. They are very good at their work and receive regular orders every month. 

She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to grow her family business. With the loan, they will buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to fulfill the orders of their clients and increase their profits. 

They have been running this business for past 10 years and have a good base of clientele. She hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for their business and increase their income.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material

loans.name: Eziel

texts.en:
Eziel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Eziel has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish and also hypo (calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant) in plastic containers. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Eziel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Anh was born in 1975. She lives in Khu 5 village. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Her family has a workshop where they produce wood furniture. She and her husband work there. They have had this job for many years. They have a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). 

Since 2010, Ms K. Anh has participated in SEDA. The last loan cycL. she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy wood. She is the group leader of 5-member group loan in SEDA.
 

Other borrowers in her group:
Nhan is 34 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND for her business.
Binh is 42 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to repair her medicine shop.
Gai is 40 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy wood.
Thoa is 5 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 56, lives in the Philippines. She is single.

Milagros has a retail shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. Milagros has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy green and yellow bananas.

Milagros is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Anggrek Bone Sma 18 Group

texts.en: Sri is the mother of four children. In the morning, she opens a stall in front of her house selling vegetables such as spinach, kale, broccoli, carrots, etc. She started this business in 1996. She is doing well with her stall and can improve her family's finances. She is asking for 3,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to buy more spinach, kale, broccoli and other vegetables. She hopes she can further increase her family's finances and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy spinach, kale, broccoli and other vegetables.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlina has a drug store shop that sells generic and affordable drugs. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional generic drugs.

Merlina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional generic drugs

loans.name: Support Kisiita Group

texts.en:
James is 48 years old, married, with five children ages 8 years old to 2 months. He has no any other dependents and he lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda.

For 5 years, James has been a farmer and also slaughters goats to sell. From this business he has been able to educate his children despite the challenge of high costs in transporting his animals. His dream is to buy a truck to transport them. James wants a loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old, married, and they have three children between ten and two years of age. He runs a retail shop business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

Patrick plans to use this loan to purchase flour, rice, sugar, detergents and beverages to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to a wholesale trade. He also has hopes of buying a plot of land in which he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, sugar, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Noris Alicia

texts.es: Noris  de 53 años vive en Soledad, municipio muy cerca de la ciudad de Barranquilla, y tiene  tres hijos en las edades de 19, 25 y 31 años de edad. Allí en este municipio estableció su negocio de vender mercancías cosméticas, mediante guías especializadas de productos desde los años 2000, desarrollando un gran mercado, que la llevó a convertirse en directora de grupos de vendedoras e impulsar las ventas  y conseguir un capital que la impulsó durante tres años, donde adicionó calzado y poco a poco fue organizándose en la línea de productos médicos naturales, con los que hoy trabaja también, distribuyéndolos entre su clientes, que son  sus vecinos, familiares, y muchos referidos de sus mejores compradores.   Desde su vinculación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha logrado diversificar sus productos y tiene el sueño de continuar incrementando su clientela, pero su capital no es suficiente para responder a pedidos de manera muy oportuna. Su mayor desafío es tener un punto comercial en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde mayormente venda de contado y continuar manteniendo una cartera sana conformada por clientes rentables. Mientras esto ocurre, Noris trabaja con el firme propósito de lograrlo, manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 14% , que planea aumentar haciendo inyecciones de crédito a su capital de trabajo.
