De esta manera su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, con él comprará mercancía variada, productos naturales, calzado cosméticos y perfumería sobre pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, pues quiere impactarlos respondiéndole efectivamente.
texts.en:
Noris is 53 years old and lives in Soledad, a town near the city of Barranquilla. She has three children (ages 19, 25, and 31). Noris has an established business where she has been selling cosmetics through specialty catalogs since 2000. She has developed a large market and worked her way up to becoming a director over a group of sales representatives. As a result of boosting her sales and acquiring enough capital, she was able to get promoted within a three-year period. At that point, she also decided to sell shoes and then added a line of natural health products that she continues to offer to this day. Noris distributes her products to neighbors, relatives, and to several referrals since they are her best customers.

Since joining Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Noris has been able to diversify her products and now dreams of continuing to expand her customer base. However, she does not have sufficient capital that will allow her to fulfill her customers’ orders in a timely manner. Her greatest challenge is finding a retail shop in the city of Barranquilla where she can generate cash sales and maintain a healthy list of profitable customers. While she works to attain this goal, Noris is able to maintain profitability from her sales of no less than 14%. She plans to utilize her loan as an injection of operating capital. This Kiva loan is her second one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy a variety of merchandise including natural products, shoes, cosmetics, and perfumes that have been ordered by her customers. Noris wants to respond to these orders in an effective manner.

loans.use: to purchase natural products, shoes, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Claudia has a retail shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copras. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Claudia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Claudia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a hardworking father engaged in farming in the Philippines. He is 56 years old and is married with one child. He has been into rice farming for eight years now. He brings out the best of him to uplift his family out from poverty through farming. 

To strengthen his farming, Reynaldo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers to ensure good production of rice that he maintains so he can generate sufficient income for his family needs. He further said that this loan will help him grow his farming through the years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to ensure good production of the rice he maintains

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children. 

Nena is provides manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for pedicure & manicure services.

Nena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicure & manicure services.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with three children, age 24, 21 and 12. His wife works as a teacher.

Nelson is a farmer who works in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice for 17 years. Nelson sells his harvest to rice traders. He earns about 8,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Nelson said he is able to support his family and send his children to school through this business.

Nelson will use this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. He hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with two children age 15 and 12. 

He operates an auto garage business in Nairobi. He has been in this business for five years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is the rainy season, since he operates in an open air market.

Geoffrey plans to use this loan to purchase auto spare parts to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open such businesses in other areas in Nairobi. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Redilla

texts.en:
Redilla is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children. She and her husband are both farmers. They live in Banga, South Cotabato, where their farm is also located. Rice is the main crop that they grow on their land. Redilla works hard to improve their business.

Redilla requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a successful business. She also hopes for her family to have a peaceful life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 40-year-old single mother of six children, living in her own house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been selling charcoal for 10 years. She got her initial capital from the savings she had out of farming. 

Her hardship is high license fees and her vision is to own a charcoal store supplying the region, plus to educate her children.

Lillian needs the loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kenjegul's Group

texts.en:
Kenjegul, 36, is treasurer of this group. 

She has been involved in farming since she got married 11 years ago. The couple is busy with several types of activities from cultivating agricultural products to breeding and reselling livestock. 

The farm is rather big and requires much of Kenjegul’s time and attention. In 10 years she has built a big shed and increased the number of cattle.  

Their monthly income is 5,000 KGS and the entrepreneur plans to further broaden the business and get a rich harvest. The purpose of the loan is to buy fuels and lubricants for hay mowing and paying for mechanic services. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricants for hay mowing and to pay for mechanic services.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Marilou has a retail shop that sells different kinds of fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 47 years old and lives in the village of San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. She is happily living with her husband and four children. All her children are still studying. 

Mildred is busy raising and selling pigs. Her husband and her eldest son helped her in her business. Mildred is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise and hog feeds. Mildred hopes that her livestock business will improve to support the needs of her family. She wants to increase her profit which is why she wants to have additional piglets to raise and sell in the future. She is hoping that generous lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and hog feeds

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is a 42-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past ten years, Cleophas has been dealing in a number of business activities including selling cloth and poultry farming. He got his initial capital to set up his current business from farming. Cleophas’s major business challenges are bad debtors and diseases that affect poultry. 

Cleophas is requesting a loan to buy chickens for his poultry farm. His vision is to rear at least 2,000 birds and educate his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is 33 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Normalita runs a business where she sells a variety of foods and prepared snacks. This is a new business. Normalita has been a member of PMPC for over a year.

Normalita is requesting a 5,000 PHP a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 36 years old and married with three children ages seven, eight, and nine. He is a farmer who tills land in Banga, South Cotabato. Remy has been growing rice for the past ten years. His farming income allows him to feed his family and send his children to school.

Remy is requesting a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to have a stable income to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en:
Soyolmaa is 48 and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2005, she has managed a food sales business. Soyolmaa’s husband supports her business everyday. Their daughter is going to enter university this year, but there is a financial problem with the university payment.
 
Soyolmaa has been thinking about how to increase her income to pay for her daughter’s education and has decided to raise her assets quickly. Currently, her business assets are MNT 1,480,000. Therefore Soyolmaa is requesting a loan to purchase the inventory of food products from abroad to increase her business assets.

loans.use: To purchase the inventory of food products from abroad to increase her business assets.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated and has 6 children. 

Eulogio has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eulogio is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Eulogio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, posho, and beans to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 20 years old, single and does not have any children yet. He operates a retail business where he sells various items including shoes, wallets, handbags, padlocks, handkerchiefs and other items at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints.

John plans to use this loan to purchase handbags, wallets and shoes to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to wholesale scale. He also has hopes to open other branches in town. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, wallets and shoes for sale

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 9 children. 

Jessica has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Jessica is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and 46 years old with five children. His plan is to continue sending his children to school so they can finish their studies someday. He needs to work harder to make this dream reality.  
 
Samuel plants rice on his farm. He has been doing this for 14 years and the business and usually earns the average net income of P28,000 each harvest, especially during wet season. With this loan he hopes to be able to supply for their needs and education of his children. 

Samuel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow on his farm. He will also use the loan to pay for the laborers fee for working in his field. Samuel knows that this loan will be a great contribution to his future success as a farmer, husband and father.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and rice seeds to grow on his farm.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 9 children. 

Enriquita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Enriquita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Nsenyi Women Group

texts.en: Suma is a forty five year old married woman with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She looks after the family with the help of her husband who is a fisherman. Their dream is to educate thier children. For three years she has been trading in fish. She started her business with 200,000 shillings and now she has 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is debtors who delay payment. Her vision to buy a refregerting van plus educating her children. Suma needs the loan to buy fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 3 children. 

Ana has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Malaka Kavling 2 Group

texts.en: Syamsuryawati is 40 years old with 4 children. She has a grocery store in front of her house. She started this business last year. She sells primary daily groceries like rice, eggs, flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. She is borrowing 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for adding items in her grocery store. She is happy because she can help her family to increase its income. In the future she wants to expand her grocery store and be a distributor for other grocery stores around her home.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, eggs, flour, etc for sale

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Morita has a food shop that serves & sells dishes, like escabeche (marinated, seared fish) & afritada (chicken/pork with tomato sauce). She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making dishes to sell.

Morita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Morita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making dishes to sell.

loans.name: Bat-Togtokh

texts.en:
Battogtokh is a 41-year-old married man who lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operated a butcher shop at Kharkhorin, a local outdoor market, for eight years. Since June 2010, he has been working as a security guard at Metropolitan Public Service in Ulaanbaatar.

Battogtokh is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials to finish his housing project. In order to complete the construction work, he needs to buy materials for the roof covering and interior structure as well. His family is currently living in a ger (Mongolian Yurt) at his sister’s plot of land until he finishes the construction. 

Battogtokh's 11-year-old son attends the local secondary school while his wife looks after their 3-year-old daughter and stays at home. He is a responsible and ambitious man who is willing to provide a good quality life for his family. He is very thankful to the lenders who are giving him an opportunity to finish the housing project.

loans.use: to buy essential building materials to complete his housing project.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is married and her husband works in a grocery store for a low income. His income is not enough for the whole family, that's why Najma started doing business a few years ago to financially support her family. She purchases used warm clothes, gets thread out of them, and then sells it to the thread sellers of the market, earning a good profit. 

She is the mother of five sons. Najma couldn't educate them due to financial constraints. Three of them also work in a grocery store while the other two stay at home. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her thread-selling business. With the loan, she will buy sweaters in larger quantities that will allow her to get more thread for selling. 

She has been doing this business for the past 14 years. She is confident that an investment will help her make more profits and make her family's life easier. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Najma.

loans.use: To buy used warm clothes (sweaters) to recycle into thread

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
"Try and try until you succeed" is the favorite motto of Warlito. Always believing that trying so hard is not a bad idea but a measurement of a successful person after overcoming all his failures but never surrendering to try again and again. 

Warlito is 49 years old. He is married with three children. One of his biggest dream is to become one of the successful farmers in the Philippines. His wife and children serve as inspiration in the business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow in his rice farm. He will also use some part of the loan to pay for labor fees for those working for him in the field. He further said that this loan will be of big help for him to stop borrowing from traders with high loan interest of five to ten percent each month.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow in his rice farm

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 41 years old, married has three children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the last five years, he has supported his family by owning and running a retail shop which he opened with money he made from farming. His main problems are high inflation and high rent, but he is determined to expand his shop into a wholesale operation and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, beers, wines and stationery to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Joyce has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of rice, by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Joyce is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Joyce hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 29 years old and married. She has a seven-year-old child. She is a farmer who works some land in Banga, South Cotabato. 

Rena has been growing rice and corn for six years. She said she earns about 8000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. Rena works hard to help provide for her family's needs. 

Rena has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs. Rena hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 24 years old, married, and had two children aged three and one. He operates a boutique at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for three years now and employs one person. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints. 

Peter plans to use this loan to purchase clothes to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business to wholesale. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cassava flour

loans.name: Malaka Jaya 3 Group

texts.en: Sula is 50 years old, married and has five children. Two years ago, she opened a kiosk in the town of Pasar Malaka Baru where she makes a living selling vegetables. Her business has been a success because she is now earning enough money to help meet her family's daily needs. She is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to pay for more herbs and vegetables, including spinach, kale and carrots, to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business to sell other types of groceries.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and herbs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and sodas to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Edwin provides  "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools for repair  and gasoline for the motorcycle.

Edwin has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Edwin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline  and additional tools for the motorcycle

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato cue (on a stick). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas & sweet potatoes.

Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 7 Group

texts.en: Lisa lives in the town of Cilincing with her husband and two children. For the last two years, she and her husband have made a living by running a retail shop located in front of their house where they sell food items such as groundnuts and peas. She is applying for a loan for 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to buy more of these items to sell to their customers. Her goal is to expand her business and earn enough money to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa, age 51, owns and operates a shop where she buys and sells coconuts for the preparation of copra. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have three children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 in order to buy coconuts to sell for making copra. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell for making copra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 43 years old, married, and has one child aged 20. She lives in her own residential house in Hoima, Uganda. For the past ten years, Mary has been dealing in produce. Her initial capital was 300,000 UGX but now she has stock worth 2,000,000 UGX. She faces the challenge of high costs for the transportation of goods. Her desire is to set up a food store. Mary needs a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her clothes sewing business. With this loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete her customers' orders in a shorter period of time and make more profits. 
Sughran is married and her husband is also a tailor by profession. His shop is located in the market and he is an expert in sewing men’s clothes while Sughran is an expert in making ladies' clothes. Sughran is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is also a tailor and helps his father in his business while her remaining children are enrolled in a school and getting an education. 
Sughran is very experienced in her work and this is her twelfth year of business. She is confident that an investment will bring even more profits to her. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and has never missed a meeting. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sughran.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine, age 46, is a widow with five children. She owns and operates a food shop that sells duck eggs, or "balot." She has been engaged in this business for 16 years. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy additional duck eggs to offer for sale.

Elaine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elaine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional duck eggs to offer for sale

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 25 years old and married. She has two children aged four and 6. 

Ritchel has been a farmer for five years. She helps her husband till their land located in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow corn and rice crops. According to Ritchel, they earn about 8000 Philippine Peso (PHP) per month from farming. This income helps provide for their needs. 

Ritchel has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en:
Jeanine is a 27-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages three and five. Both of her children are in school and her husband is a farmer. For the past three years, Jeanine has been selling second-hand clothes. Her business profit has helped her meet the needs of her family.

Jeanine is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as baby clothes, baby sheets, bedcovers, and shirts to sell. With the future profits from her business, she wishes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes, sheets, and bedcovers to sell

loans.name: Salostiano

texts.en:
Salostiano is 29 years old and married with a four-year-old child. For the past eight years, he has been a rice farmer. He also owns a carabao (water buffalo) to help till his land. Salostiano works hard to support his family and save for his child’s future.

Salostiano is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions through his business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mhark

texts.en:
Mhark, age 30 and unmarried, owns and operates a shop that sells electronic loads for several networks like GLOBE and SMART. He has had this business for three years. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000, which he will use to buy additional electronic loads to sell.
 
Mhark has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mhark hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Marialou

texts.en:
Marialou, age 38, owns and operates a shop that sells different kind of dried fish. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have one child.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy dried fish to offer for sale. 
  
Marialou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marialou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Slyvie

texts.en:
Sylivie is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who, for the past ten years, has run a business selling vegetables and fruit such as onions and berries. Her husband works in house construction and the couple has three children between the ages of three and nine years old. The profits from Sylivie’s business have enabled her to pay the school fees for her children.

Sylivie is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables that she will sell for a profit. She plans to use the future profits from her business to begin construction on her family’s house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Howard

texts.en:
Howard is 58 years old and married with six children. He manages a farming business where he plants and harvests rice to both sell and provide food for his family. 

Howard is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide to use to maintain his farm. He plans to improve his farming practices to increase his profits. Howard says that this will help him cope with the increase in commodity production nowadays and also uplift the living conditions of his family so they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and herbicide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy consmetics to sell

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 29 years of age, married, and has four children. Two of them are studying while the other two are not enrolled in a school yet. 

Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. He offers his clients good seating arrangements along with good quality food and tea. He is known among his customers for his good customer service and for serving quality food in a quality way. 

Shazia also supports her husband financially by operating a tailoring business. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as lentils, spices, cooking oil, rice, etc. for preparing better quality food and increasing his sales. 

He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Shazia is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a Punjabi restaurant

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, age 48, owns and operates a shop that sells frozen foods such as hot dogs and homemade sausage. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale.

Marieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to offer for sale

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 32-year-old man, married since 2006. He has three children. 

In order to provide his kids with a good standard of living, Bassam opened a small restaurant three years ago that serves take-away sandwiches. Using his experience for almost 10 years has helped him gain a lot of customers from the day he started.

Now Bassam has applied for this loan to redecorate the restaurant and add another type of sandwiches called "shawerma".

loans.use: To redecorate the restaurant and add another type of sandwiches called "shawerma".

loans.name: Deky

texts.en:
Deky is a 47 year-old entrepreneur. He is married to Juliana, who is 42 years old. They have four children.  Alexandro, 21 years old, graduated from university.  Geni, 18 years old, is studying at a university.  Kezia, 9 years old, is studying in the fourth grade of primary school. Gabriella is four months old. 

Deky owns a kiosk business and has been running the business for years. He initiated the business using his own capital.  When he started the business he only got a small room but he was excited to run the business. He sells goods such as rice, milk, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, mobile phone recharges, candies, etc.  Deky joined TLM group lending program and his business improved because of the loan support.

Deky dreams of operating a poultry business. He believes that this business will bring more benefits for his family. He intends to purchase chicks and fodder, as well as to renovate the used stall. Deky is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 through TLM's individual lending program.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and fodder, as well as to renovate the used stall

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer has started a small retail business buying clothing at wholesale prices and selling it by the piece, and because of the good quality of fabric that she sells people  trust her when they order a training suit outfit or a T-shirt or even a dress.

From her experience, Abeer has noticed that having a mobile clothing shop is more profitable than having a store in some area, so she has applied for this loan to buy a small bus. She will sell and distribute her products out of the bus. This way she can easily reach most of her clients and even go to new areas to sell.

loans.use: To buy a small  bus to use for distribution of clothing.

loans.name: Providance

texts.en:
Providence is a 32 year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with 2 children, ages 5 and 8.  She is divorced and for the past 5 years has been selling tomatoes wholesale.

She wishes to expand her business and also sell items in addition to tomatoes. She requires this loan so that she can purchase new goods, such as peanuts, garlic, and small fish that she will sell for a profit.  She plans to use the future profits from her business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as garlic, and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine works at the local hospital as an accountant. It is very difficult for her to meet the ends with her low salary, so she is also engaged in agriculture. She keeps livesock and chickens. She lives together with her husband and their son and daughter. They have been successfully managing the business for several years. 

Karine would like to develop her agricultural endeavors and thereby increase her working capital. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a cow, a calf, beehives, pigs, and forage. This will enable Karine to earn additional income and ensure a sustainable future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, a calf, beehives, pigs, and forage

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 36-year-old mother who was blessed to have an artistic talent in shaping straw.

Using that talent she started by making beautiful baskets from straw, then she worked on making different types of trays and mirror frames. Usually Tamam takes special orders from her customers rather than making an item and keeping a large quantity in storage. 
 
Now Tamam has applied for this loan to buy more material to make more creative stuff out of straw, hoping to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more material to make more creative things out of straw.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Prudencio, a driver, and they have three children.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liezel oversees operations of their FX Taxi transportation business. They have one unit (10 person capacity) FX taxi, which her husband drives every day in the city. Liezel also sells frozen meat products in order to have an additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 8500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php22, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for maintenance and to buy new accessories and parts for their FX taxi.  Also, she will buy additional frozen products for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Liezel dreams of being able to buy another FX taxi. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for new parts and maintenance of her FX taxi business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna trades in clothing from a rented booth at the city market.  To continue running the business successfully, Anna needs to purchase new clothing stock. With the loan's help, Anna will sell more clothing and increase her income. The income generation is very vital for Anna, who is taking care of her one child all alone. Additionally, Anna will rent another booth and develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley, 43, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, and mother to their two children. The older is in high school while the younger is in elementary.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Shirley sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Aside from the direct-selling business, Shirley also earns income by selling frozen meat products and mineral water. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers and additional frozen meat and mineral water products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Shirley dreams of being able to give her family a better life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for personal merchandise, meat product items and mineral water she needs in her business

loans.name: Najdiya

texts.en: Najdiya is a 55-year-old woman who wants to start a small home-business selling blankets, etc. to help her husband in supporting the family, so she has applied for this loan to buy blankets, covers, and sheets wholesale to be able to make good profit out of it.

loans.use: To buy blankets, covers, and sheets wholesale to start her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 32, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Darwin.  They have three children, the oldest of whom is in high school while the youngest is in elementary.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a congee food stall in the local neighborhood. She buys raw ingredients early in the morning in the market and cooks them and sells to her community from morning until midnight. It serves as a breakfast for students or afternoon snacks for the local neighborhood. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw ingredients used in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients she needs in her business.

loans.name: Alida

texts.ru:
Alida 30 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Alida yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayev v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. 
Alida seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i qusey dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Ona 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit gusey i kuric. Ona ochen userdno rabotayet i lubit svoyu rabotu.
texts.en:
Alida is 30 years old. She is maried and has two children. Alida is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her loving family.   
Alida now needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens and geese to expand her business. She has been working as a poultry farmer for three years and breeds geese and chickens.  She works very diligently and loves her job.

loans.use: to buy chickens and geese

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
This is Deonila, 60, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Genaro. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Deonila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Deonila earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. she also earns extra income from a room that is being rented beside her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 9000 in sales monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Deonila hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products for retail

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is a 38 year old Rwandan entreprenuer with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 7 years old.  His wife is a business woman.

For the past 5 years, he has been running a general store selling sugar, tuna, rice and other goods. This business has allowed him to to improve the standard of living for himself and his family. 

He requires this loan so he can continue to purchase goods that he will sell in his store to make profits.

With the future profits from his business, he wishes to renovate his family house.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale in his general store

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea has two children, four and one years old. She works in a garment factory, and her husband is a cook. Together, their income is $6 a day. Every month she spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $10 on transportation.

Sochea is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She has a plan to raise pigs to sell when she can save enough money.

Sochea is working hard to be able to send her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik sells shoes in a rented booth at the city market. 

Shushanik dreams of renovating her house and providing necessary education for her growing sons. For these reasons, she plans to increase the variety of shoes she sells and further develop her business. With the requested loan Shushanik plans to purchase more shoes to sell. Additional income will help Shushanik to ensure a sustainable future for her family. 

Shushanik lives with her husband, pensioner father-in-law, and two sons.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha has two children, six and three years old. She works in a garment factory, and her husband is a security guard. Their income is $6 a day. Every month she must spend $30 on food, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses.

Chantha is requesting a loan of $400 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. Her work in the factory is very tiring, so she plans to raise animals at home to sell instead when she has saved enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a 32 year old Rwandan entrepreneur with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 14 years old. She is married to a businessman and she owns a wholesale food store. 

She has run this business for the past 8 years and the profits from it have enabled her to build a family house and pay the school fees for her children. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business and sell charcoal in addition to food at her store.

With the future profits from her business, she wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 29-year-old single lady who has a high school diploma. Because she wanted to have an income source, Lisa started a year ago a small home-business selling home products as shown in the picture.

Now Lisa wants to expand the business to include other types of home products based on her customers needs, and to do so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To add more home products to her inventory.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Sothy has four children; two are studying and the other two are working in a factory earning $3 a day each.

Sothy is also a garment factory worker, while her husband raises chickens to sell. Together their income is $5 a day. Every month, she must spend $50 on food, $20 on transportation, $15 on school fees, and $25 on other expenses.

Sothy is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a cow so as to sell its calf once born. In the future, she will help her husband to raise more chickens to sell, as this career can result in a good income.

Sothy plans to send her children to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow so as to sell its calf once born.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en: Georgi is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and has an orchard. With the loan's help, Georgi will increase the number of livestock in his business by purchasing cows and calves. This will make Georgi's dream of having a big farm come true. Increased income means a brighter future for Georgi and his family. Georgi lives together with his wife and parents.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Malolit

texts.en:
This is Malolit, 34, resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She has been separated from her husband and has an adopted child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her child’s studies, which is a dream for most poor Filipino parents, like Malolit. She herself has been an undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. 

Malolit operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure and pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1430 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 34,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Malolit dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty product items she uses in her business

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is alone in her house. Every month she must spend $30 on food, $15 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She sells Khmer skirts, earning $3 a day in income.

Before selling skirts, Samer was a farmer, but that work was too tiring to do alone. So she then saved enough money to buy a weaving machine to make skirts to sell.

Samer’s new business is very successful. She would like to grow her business so that she can earn more income for herself to save for when she grows old. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy silk to make more skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy silk to make more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza, 31, resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, who assists her with the business. She is also a mother to their children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Riza operates a piggery. She earns income by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from the piggery, she has a food stall in the morning that serves breakfast. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. A portion of the loan will be used to buy a sack of rice and groceries for her food stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Riza hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and products she used in her businesses

loans.name: Pap

texts.en: Pap keeps livestock and has an orchard. He would like to increase his livestock and develop farming. With the requested loan, Pap plans to purchase two cows and two calves. Development of agriculture will help Pap increase his income and ensure a sustainable future for his family. Pap lives together with his father, wife, and adult child.

loans.use: to pay for livestock

loans.name: Tosondalai

texts.en:
Mrs. Tosondalai, 36, is a sewer who lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia with her husband and two children who are 14 and 16 years old. She has been running her business making clothes for five years. Previously, she worked as a master sewer in the garment industry. She hired one sewer to help her business part time. 

In recent times, her house fence became very bad and dangerous overall. So she is planning to rebuild it fully with block bricks. To make it safe or solid, she needs a total of 3,000 pieces of block bricks to build it. Therefore, she is taking a loan of MNT 2,500,000 to build a new block fence.

loans.use: To build a new block fence

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Yong has two children, both of whom are working in a factory earning $2 a day each. She and her husband are farmers, and their income is $3 a day. Every month she must spend $40 on food, $20 on transportation, $5 on electricity and $20 on other expenses.

Yong would like to request a loan of $700 to start a business selling food so that she is able to earn more money to support her family. If business is good, she will grow it to sell more food through her home and stop farming.

loans.use: to start a business selling food.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is 45 years old. Her husband Waleed has recently retired. They have three sons and two daughters. Khawla is a hard working mother who makes different kinds of spices such as thyme and sumac and sells them at the market. Her plan in the future is to have her own land to grow plants so she can make more types of spices. To do that she has applied for a loan to buy more ingredients to make the spices as a start until she has enough money to buy a small piece of land.

Since Khawla is a conservative person, she asked that her husband Waleed appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make spices

loans.name: Poul

texts.en:
Poul is married and has two children, seven and one years old. She works in a garment factory, while her husband is a security guard. Together their income is $5 a day. Every month she must spend $50 on food, $15 on rent, $15 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

Poul is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service and so earn more money when he is off from work. When he can save enough money, Poul’s husband wants to buy a tok tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) because a motor taxi service makes less money than a tok tok business.

Poul plans to send her children to school so they will at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is a food seller who earns about $3 a day. She is a single mother with five children, two of whom are in school while the other three work in a local factory where they earn earn about $2.50 a day. Every month, Yon has to spend about $50 on food, $15 on rent for her house, $20 on transportation, $5 on school fees and $15 on other items. She is applying for a loan for $600 to buy a motorbike for her son, who earns a living by providing motor taxi services. This loan will help her son launch his own career so that he can support himself and not have to depend on his family to help meet his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son so that he can provide motor taxi services.

loans.name: Ogab

texts.en: Ogab is 44 years old.  After retiring from the military, he opened his own stationary store selling office stationary and some computer parts. He also has a copy machine for those who want to copy some papers or documents. The store has been successfully running for six years. Now Ogab has applied for this loan in order to redecorate the stationary store to be more organized.

loans.use: To redecorate his stationary store

loans.name: Srihorng

texts.en: Srihorng sells flowers and feeds the chickens. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $10 per day. She has three children who are five, three and one years old. Every month she has to spend $83 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $40 on transportation, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase a new motorbike for the Tok Tok service because the current motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to have a store in Phnom Penh market to sell flowers so that she can make a good income to help her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Sinout

texts.en:
Sinout is a vegetable seller and raises chickens to sell. Her husband plants mushroom to sell and also raises chickens with his wife. Their income is $15 per day. They have three children, and all of them are studying. 

Every month, Sinout has to spend $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $80 on school fees, $60 on transportation, and $70 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy vegetables and meat to sell to the villagers. In the future, she wants to extend her business raising chickens so that she can have enough money to repair her house and make it better.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and meat to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly is a pig feeder and makes wine to sell. Her husband is a car driver, and their income is $10 per day. She has three children; all of them are studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fee, $30 on transportation, and $50 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy rice to use for making wine to sell. She used to be a teacher but she could not make a  good income to support her family so she tried raising pigs at home, first one and then two and now she can make good income from selling pigs, so she wants to extend her livestock raising by buying more pigs to feed and sell. As for her children, she will try to support them while they study in the university.

loans.use: To buy rice to use for making wine to sell.

loans.name: Binnat

texts.ru:
Binnat yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselencem iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Binnat 58 let. 
On uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov. Binnat prodayot molochniye produkti v magazini. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi.
texts.en:
Binnat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  He is married and has four children. Binnat is 58 years old.
 
He has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for thirteen years already.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase milk production. Binnat sells dairy products in stores. He started this business with his uncle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Odonchimeg, 35, is a hard-working mother who is trying to educate her children. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia with her husband, 39, and two children who are 18 and 16 years old. She has been running a business selling building materials in the market. 

Her daughter Ankhzul graduated secondary school last year and she will become a student at the university as soon. But there is a problem with her daughter’s school payment. Therefore, Odonchimeg is taking a loan to pay her daughter's university costs.  “Most important thing is the education of my kids,” she said.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal, 48, is a widow who lives with her two children. She has worked as a meat seller in a bazaar since 1995. At first, she started her business with a group of sellers, but she has been running her business individually since last year. Currently, her circulating assets are almost MNT 2,000,000. There is a necessity to make repairs to her house because it is becoming old and uncomfortable to live there.
 
She is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000 to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibarahima,agé de 55 ans, est marié pére de 5 enfants.Il est photographe et s'active également dans le métier de gardiennage afin de diversifier ses revenus. Il a appris le métier de photoraphe à travers un ami qu'il assistait lors des couvertures de cérémonies familiales et autres. Ainsi, la passion lui domina et décida, il y'a plus de 10 ans, d'acheter son premier appareil pour son propre business.Pour mieux augmenter ses revenus, il souhaitait un prêt de 75 000 FCFA pour acheter un autre appareil photo.
texts.en: Mr. Ibrahima, 55 years of age, is married and the father of five. He is a photographer and also works as a security guard to diversify his income sources. He learned photography from a friend whom he helped with taking photo of family ceremonies etc. And thus he grew passionate about this work and decided, over 10 years, to buy his first camera for his own business. In order to increase his earnings, he would like to receive a loan of 75,000 West African francs to buy a new photo camera.

loans.use: to buy a photo camera

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari lives together with her husband, mother-in-law and husband's brother. She is a teacher at the local school. A teacher's salary is not enough to meet the needs of the family, so she is also engaged in farming. 

Mari would like to increase her livestock and develop agriculture. Increasing the number of livestock will help Mari to get additional income and improve her family's living conditions. With the loan's help, Mari will be able to make her dream come true and own a big farm.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en:
Enkhchimeg, 35, lives with her husband and her three-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant in a home furnishing store since 2005.

Enkhchimeg would like to start her own retail business selling merchandise like household commodities. To do so, she would need a loan to cover the costs of renting a building space, purchasing commodities and transporting goods from abroad. Therefore, Enkhchimeg is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT.

loans.use: to start her own business selling household commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Mme Alimata est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 7ans..2 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes.

Elle vend une boutique depuis 12ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les gens du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 10sacs de riz(5sacs de riz brisure et 5sac riz simple),05 litres de bidon d’huile ;05 cartons de patte alimentaire ;02 carton de savon et 05 carton de bonbon. 

Avec ses économies, elle veut s’acheter une parcelle. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un hangar au marché pour vendre des céréales. Et aussi aider son mari à construire une grande maison dans leur cours.
texts.en:
Ms. Alimata is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is 7. Two of them go to school. She has five persons to support. Alimata has been selling out of a shop for twelve years. She gets her supplies at the big market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are people from the area. 

She wants to buy 10 sacks of rice (5 of broken rice and 5 of plain rice), a 5-liter container of oil, 5 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of soap, and 5 boxes of candies. 

With her savings, Alimata wants to buy a plot of land. Her ambition is to buy a covered stall at the market to sell grains and also to help her husband build a large house.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice (5 of broken rice and 5 of plain rice), a 5-liter container of oil, 5 boxes of pasta, 2 boxes of soap, and 5 boxes of candies

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Madame Ndella est à sa deuxième demande de crédit dans son IMF. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Commerçante de métier, Madame souhaite acheter des marchandises avec ce prêt. Elle a été initié dans ce métier par ses copines qui vendent des tissus à crédit à travers la ville.
texts.en: Ms. Ndella is on her second request for a loan at her micro-finance institution. She is married and the mother of four children. A merchant by trade, she would like to purchase some merchandise with her loan. She was introduced to this trade by her friends who sell cloth on credit throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and finery and to resell them

loans.name: Wendsongdo Watinoma Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline est la représentante du groupe Wendsongdo Watinoma.Elle est Mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 04ans.03 vont à l’école et elle n’a personne en charge, comme les enfants vivent actuellement avec leur père.

Elle vend du haricot préparé (restauration)depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy.Ses clients sont ceux qui fréquentent le marché, ses amis et voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’haricot ; 01 bidon de 20litres d’huile et 01 sac de farine de maïs (couscous).

Mme renforce son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne vendre en gros les sacs d’haricots et d’aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline represents the Wendsongdo Watinoma group.  She is married and the mother of 5 children.  The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 4.  Three of them attend school and she does not have anyone else in her care at this time because the kids are with their father. 

She has been preparing and serving cooked beans for two years.  Mrs. Pauline gets her supplies at the market in Pissy.  Her customers are those who shop at the market, her friends, and neighbors. 

She wants to buy one sack of beans, one 20-liter can of oil, and one sack of corn flour (couscous). 

She will use her profits to build up her business.  Her goal is to sell sacks of beans wholesale to help pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy one sack of beans, one 20-liter can of oil, and one sack of corn flour (couscous).

loans.name: Fight For Poor Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is fifty years old and was born in Yoni village. She is married to a nurse, and the couple has four children, one of whom is still attending primary school. For over ten years now, Hawa has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), foofoo (a food made out of cassava roots) and groundnuts.

Hawa and her group members have applied for a loan from SMT, with 1,000,000 SLL to go to each member. Hawa will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm oil, foofoo and groundnuts in bulk. With the help of this loan, Hawa’s group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil, foofoo and groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with one son aged four years old. He operates a tailoring shop at a local market in Kitengela. He has been in this business for seven years now and hires two employees. He describes himself as customer friendly.

Peter says while the business is profitable, the only major challenge he faces is financial constraints. Peter plans to use this loan to purchase more sewing materials so as to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a branch at Mlolongo shopping center.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She is 36 years old and was born in Makeni. She is married to a tailor, and the couple has three children who are attending primary and secondary school.

For the past ten years Zainab has been selling shoes, slippers, flip-flops and vests. With her share of the loan her group is requesting, Zainab would like to try a new type of business: selling groundnuts and palm oil. To do so, she will use her loan portion to buy bags of groundnuts and gallons of palm oil.

With the help of this loan, Zainab and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts and gallons of palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est âgé de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Daniel est marié à une ménagère du nom de Rebbéca. Le couple a un  enfant scolarisé et vivant avec eux. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Daniel a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Daniel a appris le métier de couture. Daniel exerce cette activité passionnément depuis trois ans dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Daniel vend des produits de mercerie dans son atelier de couture. Daniel achète ses produits au Bénin. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Daniel sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le premier crédit dont Daniel avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Daniel is 26 years old and lives in Benin.  His wife is a homemaker named Rebbéca.  The couple has one child who lives with them and attends school.  They work together to cover the various household  expenses.  Daniel only went to school for a short time.  He learned to become a tailor in order to cover his family’s needs.  He has been working passionately in this field for three years in a city in Benin.  On the side, Daniel also sells dry goods out of his tailor studio.  He purchases his supplies in Benin.  In order to increase his working capital and to better meet his customers’ needs, Daniel is asking for financial support from Alidé for the second time.  He has paid back the first loan that he took out.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making shirts

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba est agée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. C'est sous l'influence de sa belle soeur, une grande commerçante, qu'elle a commencé à faire du commerce afin de combattre l'oisiveté et subveniraux besoins de ses enfants. C'est ainsi qu'elle s'est virée dans le commerce de tissus. Enfin elle souhaitait un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs Dieynaba is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of three.
Under the influence of her sister-in-law, an established merchant, she started in retail to combat idleness and support her children. This is how she got her start in retailing fabrics.
She now wishes to be granted a loan of 100,000 FCFA to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to retail.

loans.name: Ruth Mutindi

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old, married, and has two children aged seven and four years old. She describes herself as independent and visionary.

For the past three years Ruth has operated a shop selling spare parts for cars at a local market in Kitengela. She says while the business is profitable, the challenge she faces is financial constraints.

Ruth plans to use this loan to purchase tires and engine oil to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to continue growing her business and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy tires and engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Félix ne vit plus avec sa femme, mais vit seul avec ses deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Félix assure seul les diverses charges de la maison. Félix a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Félix a appris le métier de couture. Félix exerce cette activité passionnément depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire, Félix vend des produits congelés et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Félix achète ses produits dans l'une des villes du Bénin. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Félix sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Félix, 37, lives in Bénin. He no longer lives with his wife but lives alone with his two children, both enrolled in school and both his responsibility. He supports his family alone. 

 Félix attended school up to the secondary level. To support himself and his family, he learned to be a tailor. He has been enthusiastically involved in this work for 10 years. Secondarily, he sells frozen foods and telephone recharge cards. He buys his products in a city in Bénin. Wishing to better satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make outfits.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.fr: Gervais est âgé de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Gervais est est un veuf ayant à sa charge quatre enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Gervais assure seul les diverses charges de la maison. Gervais a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins  et ceux de sa famille, Gervais a appris le métier de couture. Ce métier est exercé passionnément par Gervais depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Gervais vend divers produits et des chaussures. Gervais achète ses produits dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Gervais sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Gervais, 36, lives in Bénin. He is a widower raising four children. All the children are enrolled in school. Gervais is the sole breadwinner for his family. He attended school up to the secondary level. To support his family and himself, he learned tailoring. He has enthusiastically worked at this trade for eight years. Secondarily, he sells various products and shoes. He buys his merchandise in a market in Bénin. Wishing to better satisfy the demand of his clientele, Gervais is requesting his second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sew shirts.

loans.name: Sa-Ben Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sa-Ben” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each member in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom are attending primary schools. Isatu sells cotton cloths, vests, shirts, and portmanteaus.  She has been running this business for five years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business through buying cotton cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes and portmanteaux in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cotton cloths, ready-to-wear-clothes and portmanteaux in large quantities

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Seith

texts.en:
Seith is a 31 years old, 3 children 4-7, wife is business woman, he sells spare parts for cars ,he been doing for past 11 years, has enabled him to feed and meet the needs of his family, needs loan to buy more spare parts he  buys from Uganda. With profits he plans to start saving his income so that he may provide for his family in the future. 

For the past 11 years, he has been running a business selling spare car and motorcycle parts. The income generated from this business has enabled him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 54 years old and a widow from Nyalenda town in Kisumu County. She has four children who are in high school.

Mary has a grocery store that she has been running for the past 17 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables to add to her stock. 

Mary is optimistic that the loan will help boost her business. She hopes to open up a big grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, garlic and vegetables

loans.name: Asseta

texts.fr:
Mme Asseta est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Tous vont à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle confectionne et vend des chapeaux, des chemises d’homme depuis 1an et demi. Mme s’approvisionne dans les merceries de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont  les membres des Eglises et surtout les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 12 roulots de tissus pour les chapeaux et 10 mètres de tissus pour les chemises.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et s’occupe aussi de ses besoins personnels. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour son activité et aider son mari à s’occuper de de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Asseta is a married woman and the mother of three children. The eldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 10. All of them go to school. She has one person to support. Asseta has been making and selling hats and men's shirts for a year and a half. She is supplied from sewing stores in Ouagadougou. Her customers are church members and women in particular. 

She wants to buy 12 rolls of cloth for making hats and 10 meters of cloth for making shirts. 

She is saving her profits and also meeting her personnel needs. Her ambition is to open a store for her business and to help out her husband to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 12 rolls of cloth for making hats and 10 meters of cloth for making shirts

loans.name: Sorbeh Iii Group

texts.en:
Adama is the leader of the Sorbeh III group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is 36 years old, married to a tailor and has four children, two in primary school and two in secondary school.

The Sorbeh III group members are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,600,000 SLL, with each to receive a 1,200,000 SLL portion. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions.
