For eight years now Adama has sold rice, palm oil, sugar, margi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), gari (a food made out of cassava roots), etc. With her share of this loan, Adama will buy these foods at wholesale to add to her current business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, sugar, margi, gari, etc. at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
From Kisumu, Alice is 32 years old and married to Kennedy. They have three children who are in school.

Alice runs a grocery store. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to buy bananas, watermelon and passion fruit to add to her stock. She will use the profits made to help her with her family's needs and pay school fees for her children.

Alice hopes to expand her business and have a big house of her own in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelon and passion fruit to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and garlic to add to her stock.

loans.name: Joyce Mueni

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old, married and has four children between twenty and eight years of age. She describes herself as independent, reliable and visionary.

Joyce operates a shop where she sells spare parts for cars at a local market in Kitengela. She has been in this business for thirteen years now and hires six employees. She says while the business is profitable, she does face the challenge of financial constraint.
 
Joyce plans to use this loan to purchase tires to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to continue growing her business and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is forty years old, married and the father of four children. He runs a carpentry workshop in Mariakani, Mombasa.

Rashid has been in business for the last fifteen years, and his shop has been a success. This request for a loan is his third from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Rashid plans to purchase more timber. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business.

Rashid’s dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who is divorced with two children ages three and six.  

For the past 10 years, he has been running a business selling a variety of goods such as sandals, mirrors, sugar, and salt.  

He needs a loan in order to purchase more of these goods and continue to meet the demands of his customers. 

He plans to use the future profits to build a small business house and to save for his and his children’s futures.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for sale such as sandals, mirrors etc.

loans.name: Luis Alfro

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años,  es el propietario de un negocio llamado “Tienda la Única”, a 10 minutos del mar, allí donde vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 18, tiene un punto de venta donde las amas de casa y la comunidad  de su barrio y de sus alrededores, compran al detalle productos de la canasta familiar, como ranchos, víveres, bebidas abarrotes etc. Sus clientes lo reconocen y cada día sus productos rotan mucho más rápido hasta quedarse sin existencia de algunos de ellos.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, con ello conservaría un stock de mercancías no perecederas,  como café, azucar, arroz, aceite, enlatados, refrescos y ahorraría en precio  por la compra en volumen y también el transporte, adicionalmente teniendo productos que muy pronto terminan para no decir “no hay” a sus clientes. 
Luis inició su vida comercial hace 25 años  aproximadamente,  cuando proveniente de su natal zapoteca (departamento de Santander) se instaló en la Costa caribe e inició como empleado de una tienda, después se independizó en inició la distribución de productos lácteos en una bicicleta y agregó galletería y confitería, simultáneamente trabajó en tareas de la construcción, en una panadería hasta que recapitulando su experiencia, emprendió hace 7 meses su negocio de tienda con mucho éxito y por la aceptación que tiene de su clientela en su nicho de mercado. Luis tien el gran apoyo de su familia especialmente de sus dos hijos, que ya construyen su experiencia empresarial en su negocio mientras estudian, por eso su mayor anhelo es dejarle algún dia una fuente de ingreso segura y para ello debe trabajar persistentemente y con disciplina. Mientras esto ocurre su actual negocio le permite una rentabilidad sobre las ventas  no menor del 8,7% mientras su costo de ventas es de un 84,1% .
texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and the owner of a business called “Tienda la Única” (The Only Store), which is 10 minutes away from the sea. He lives with his wife and their four children who range in age from 12 to 18. Housewives from the community and the surrounding areas come to his store to buy everyday items for their families such as snacks, food, beverages, groceries, and other items. His customers know him and his products sell quickly to the point that he runs out of a few items. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy in large quantities so that he can maintain a stock of non-perishable goods such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks. By purchasing in volume, Luis will be able to get a discount and also save on shipping costs. In addition, by having more products in stock, he can stop saying “We’ve run out” to his customers.

Luis started working approximately 25 years ago. This native of Zapoteca, in the Department of Santander, moved to the Caribbean coast and started a job as a store clerk. Afterwards, he became independent and started selling dairy products from a bicycle. He also started selling candy and cookies while holding down other jobs working in construction and at a bakery so that he could gain experience. Seven months ago, Luis opened his store with great success and a warm reception from the customers who make up his niche market. Luis has the support of his family, especially from two of his children who have gained business experience while going to school. His greatest wish is to one day leave them with a secure source of income so that they can work persistently and with discipline. In the meantime, his current business is generating sales profitability of no less than 8.7% while his cost of sales is 84.1%.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable goods in bulk such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ta-Kar-Su Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Ta-Kar-Su” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member in the group. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mohamedd. Mohamedd is 45 and was born in Makeni, where he is currently lives with his wife and child. His wife is a businesswoman and his child is attending secondary school. For 23 years now, Mohamedd has been selling used clothes. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 28-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages four and five. She is married to a moto driver.

For the past five years, she has been selling vegetables. This business has improved the standard of living for her family.

She requires a loan so that she can continue to buy vegetables that she will sell for a profit.

With her future profits, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ann Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie is a 45-year-old Rwanandan entrepreneur with a 17-year-old child.  She is a widow and her child is still in school.

For the past 20 years, she has worked as a tailor who sells a variety of clothing. Her successful business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family.

She will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine and threads for her work. 

With her future profits, she plans to accumulate savings and school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted plastic items like cups, plates, trays and tea kettles to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is a 26-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages six and seven. Her husband owns a bar selling beer.

For the past 10 years, she has been selling vegetables. The profits from this business have enabled her to take care of her children.

She will use this loan to purchase more vegetables that she will sell for a profit.  She plans to save her future profits to be able to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is 49 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a café proprietor in Mariakani. Sidi has been in this business for the last eleven years, and her income has been great.

Sidi is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD to build up more of her dry food stocks such as beans, wheat flour and sugar. She will use her anticipated profits to service her KADET loan and to sustain her family.

loans.use: to build up more of her dry food stocks such as beans, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a large quantity of beverages, chicken, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Bwambara Women's Progressive Group

texts.en:
Gard is a 57-year-old gentleman with a funny sense of humor. The assiduous father of six exudes confidence when he talks. Not only has his confidence and humor gotten him into the good graces of his family but also into those of his clientele. 

His 5-year-old food sales stall at one of Rukungiri's biggest food markets is a beehive of activity.  Rukungiri is one of the preeminent districts in Western Uganda where farming is rife. Gard has a farm where he grows and harvests crops that he sells. Because most people carry out their farming on a large scale in Western Uganda, they in most cases end up joining the lucrative food sales trade. Gard has been one of them. 

Rukungiri is regarded as one of the leading food basket districts in Uganda. Most of the crops which people like Gard sell, principally bananas, cassava, yams, and maize are transported all the way to the country's capital, Kampala, for sale. This business has been paying dividends for many farmers from Western Uganda. Gard mostly sells bananas, cassava, and maize. He says this business despite the dividends is costly in terms of transport. Transporting foods to different food markets is expensive and it’s even more costly when one wants to transport their foods to the more lucrative food markets in Kampala.

Gard also ekes out additional income from his goat and coffee sales businesses. Weekly he says the businesses gross profits amount to Ugandan shillings 140,000.  He intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase higher grade manure for his farms and also use the rest to pay fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase higher grade manure for his farms and also to pay fees for his children.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Basco is a 36-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married with three children between the ages of 6 and 10.  

For the past nine years, he has run a butchery. The profits from this successful enterprise have helped him improve the standards of living for his family. 

He requires this loan to buy more meat for his shop that he will sell for a profit. 

He plans to save future profits so that he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en:
Aloise is a 45-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 15 and 22, all of whom are in school.  Her husband owns a general store and she sells fruits.

She has been running this business for the past 18 years, and requires this loan so she can purchase 300 kg of tree tomatoes, 100 kg of oranges, and 500 kg of tangerines. She plans to save future profits so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy different fruits such as oranges, tangerines and tomatoes

loans.name: Mame Aly

texts.fr: Mosieur Aly, marié et pére de 5 enfants, fait le commerce depuis l'âge tout jeune. Il aidait son père grand commerçant d'alors. Actuellement il gére son propre business et vend du mil, de l'arachide et des pesticides. Il est à sa troisième demande de prêt et souhaitait avoir pour cette fois ci 400 000 FCFA.Les prêts antérieurs lui ont permis d'augmenter ses revenus considérablements ce qui lui a permis d'acquérir selon lui des biens mobiliers et ménagers .
texts.en: Mr. Aly is a married man and the father of five children. He has been working in commerce from a very young age. He used to help his father, who was a major merchant at the time. Currently, Aly manages his own business and sells millet, peanuts, and pesticides. He is on his third request for a loan and wished to have 400,000 francs CFA for this instance. The previous loans enabled him to increase his revenues considerably, and he says this allowed him to acquire furnishings and household items.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar  de 40 años vive en el barrio San José y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 10 años. Allí  tiene como negocio vender productos del mar;  Oscar prepara deliciosos cabritos, (Producto estrella) es decir bocachicos rellenos de verduras en su asador y también cocteles de camarón chipichipi, cazuela de mariscos, alimentos por los cuales es muy reconocido en la comunidad y que hacen que cada día gane su negocio una mayor clientela.  Su menú está conformado por los supercostales, pescado asado, pescado en cabrito que acompaña con refrescos especialmente los fines de semana. Su meta es darle una mayor forma y presentación a su negocio y gradualmente lograr un confort para sus clientes que ya no solo quieren llevar su producto sino también degustarlo en las mismas instalaciones. Esta es la razón por la cual con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará una carpa, y mayor volumen de sus materias primas e insumos para lograr que las delicias ofrecidas se extiendan mucho más entre nuevos clientes y obtener un mayor capital de trabajo para este propósito. 
Mientras Oscar trabaja para lograr sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 17,7%, su razón corriente es de 1,8% sus inventarios rotan cada dos días mientras sus cuentas por pagar cada 3 días.
texts.en:
Oscar is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San José. He has two children, ages 4 and 10. Oscar has a business selling products from the sea. He sells “cabritos”, which are grilled bocachico fish stuffed with vegetables. Oscar also sells seafood cocktails with shrimp and clams, seafood stew, and other dishes that are well-known in the community. Every day is able to gain more customers for his business. His menu consists of marinated seafood, roasted fish, and stuffed fish that are served with beverages, particularly on the weekends. Oscar’s goal is to make his business more presentable and comfortable for his customers so that they will not only want to order his food but also stay and enjoy it in the same place.

For this reason, Oscar is requesting a Kiva loan, his first instance of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy a canopy and a large amount of ingredients and supplies for preparing his delicious food. This will allow him to attract new customers and obtain more operating capital for expanding his business. In the meantime, Oscar works toward achieving his goals. He maintains a sales profitability rate of no less than 17.7% and a cash flow of 1.8%. His inventory turnover period is two days while his accounts payable period is three days.

loans.use: to purchase a canopy and a large amount of ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Agé de 73 ans, Monsieur Ibrahima est un éleveur très expérimenté. Il assure également l'agent de sécurité de l'école primaire de son village. Ces derniers, nous confie-t-il, il a simplifié son travail vu son âge avancé. Il fait un peu d'élevage en achétant pour revendre afin de ganer un peu de bénéfice comme ça avec son revenu qu'il tire de l'école, il pourra subvenir à ses besoins pas trop important pour lui.
texts.en: At the age of 73, Monsieur Ibrahima is a very experienced livestock raiser. He also acts as the security guard for the primary school in his village. This, he confides, has simplified his work, in view of his advanced age. He tends a few animals, buying for resale in order to make a little profit. In that way, with the salary he draws from the school, he will be able to support himself as he doesn't need much.

loans.use: to buy sheep or goats.

loans.name: Constace

texts.en:
Constance is a 50-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 7 and 27 years old, all of whom are in school.  She is a widow and sells vegetables.

She has been running her business for the past 27 years and it has enabled her to feed her family and pay for her children’s medical insurance. 

She will use the money from this loan to purchase 250 kg of peanuts, 250 kg of onions, 20 basins of tomatoes, carrots, and green beans.  

With the future profits from this business, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and save funds for their futures

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Madame Thioro est âgée de 44 ans et est mère de 4 enfants. Elle vend au marché central de la ville diverses marchandises. Elle s'approvisionne un peu partout dans le pays. Avec ce prêt qu'elle sollicite, elle comptait s'approvisionner en produits de mer ( poissons séchés, poissons fumés....) et d'autres produits qu'elle va acheter au sud du pays .
texts.en: Madame Thioro is 44 and the mother of four children. She sells various goods in the central market of the town. She buys her merchandise here and there in the country. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to stock up on seafood (dried fish, smoked fish, etc.) and other products that she will buy in the south of the country.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Sandra  D. 23 años es una joven muy creativa dedicada a L. lencería y L. fabricación D. manualidades en general, posee un taller donD. se fabrican carteras bolsos  para damas, se decoran peinetas, pulseras  entre otras bellezas que elabora con sus propias manos;  actividad que inició cuando al terminar su carrera profesional como diseñadora, no logró encontrar en una empresa L. forma D. desarrollar su potencial y decidida emprendió su aventura D. negocios, aplicando las técnicas del diseño que aprendió en L. universidad, por eso sus productos son D. una excelente calidad y son muy aceptados y reconocidos entre sus clientes, porque a todo lo que hace le agrega el valor D. su saber y creatividad. Su meta es lograr posicionar una marca propia y tener un punto comercial especializado D. sus productos. Su credikiva es el primer crédito que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materiales e insumos a un mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos y sobre todo para tener materiales con los que diversifique, al aplicar las diferentes técnicas que conoce perfectamente. Mientras Sandra trabaja para lograr sus sueños, en su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor D. un 25%, una rotación D. inventarios D. 8 días y D. sus cuentas por cobrar 8 días también.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 23, is an extremely creative and dedicated young woman who sells lingerie and produces handcrafted items. She has a workshop where she makes wallets and handbags for women. Sandra decorates her creations by hand with ornamental hair pins, bracelet beads, and other beautiful items. She started this business after she finished her professional degree as a designer. However, she was not able to find a company where she could develop her potential, so she decided to pursue the path of starting a business. She applies the design techniques she learned in college and, as a result, she produces creations that are of excellent quality and have been well-received and recognized among her customers. Her knowledge and creativity add value to everything she produces. Sandra's goals are to obtain her own brand and to have a specialized retail shop for her products.

Her Kiva loan is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Sandra will use the funds to buy materials and supplies in large volumes so that she can obtain discounts and have all the equipment that she needs to diversify and apply the various techniques that she knows perfectly. While Sandra works to achieve her dreams, her business manages to generate a sales profitability rate of no less than 25%. Her product rotation period is 8 days and her accounts receivable period is also 8 days.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies in large quantities.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 61-year-old widow with seven children between the ages of twenty and forty years old.

For the past eleven years Rose has run a dairy. Her business has enabled her to provide for her children and pay her rent.

Rose is requesting this loan so she can buy 500 liters of milk that she will sell at a profit. She plans to use future profits to pay the school fees for her children and accumulate savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 38-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  She has 11 children between the ages of 1 and 18 and her husband works as a driver.  

For the past four years, she has owned a general store in which she sells goods such as rice, sugar, and salt.  This business has allowed her to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

She will use this loan to purchase 50 kg of sugar and salt and 150 kg of rice that she will sell at her place of business for a profit. 

With the future profits from her business, she plans to feed her children and begin saving so she may provide for them in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and rice to sell

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou est agé de 37 ans. C'est un homme marié avec 5 enfants. Il est boutiquier, métier auquel il associe à l'activité d'embauche bovine. Il a d'abord exercé dans la boutique de son oncle avant de s'associer avec son grand frèrepour mettre en place leur propre boutique d'alimentatio générale.
Pour L'élevage, Aliou est un habitué car grandissant dans une zone où  l'elevage est prédominant. Ainsi il souhaitait un prêt de 300 000 FCFA pour préparer une opération Tabaski (fête musulmane appelée fête du sacrifice) où les moutons font bon marché.
texts.en:
Aliou is 37. He is a married man with five children. He runs a small shop, and he also raises livestock. He worked first in his uncle's shop before getting together with his older brother to start up their own general store. 

As for tending livestock, Aliou is experienced since he grew up in an area where livestock raising predominates. Thus he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to get ready for Tabaski (a Muslim feast day called "feast of the sacrifice") where sheep are sold in great numbers.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Virgnie

texts.en:
Virgnie is a 44-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with five children between the ages of 6 and 11.  Her husband is not working and she runs a business selling vegetables.  

She has been doing this business for the past 17 years and it has helped feed her family, pay for medical insurance, pay school fees, and save money. 

She will use this loan to purchase more vegetables that she will sell for a profit so that she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou est un jeune célibataire âgé de 23 ans. Il était gérant d'un poulailler d'un professeur de lycée. Comme il  est et travailleur, ce dernier lui céda le local afin de l'aider à travailler son propre compte.Ainsi Sliou qui a trés tôt quitté l'école saisit l'opportunité et décide de développer son aviculture. C'est ainsi qu'il fait appel à IMCEC son IMF du coin pour le financement de cetee activité d'aviculture. Il souhaitait un prêt de 100 000 Fcfa pour l'achat de quelques poussins et de leur alimentation.
texts.en: Saliou is a young single man of 23. He was managing a hen house for a high school teacher. Since he worked hard, the teacher let him have the premises to run a business of his own. Thus, Saliou, who left school at a young age, seized the opportunity and decided to develop his poultry raising project. That is why he is turning to IMCEC, his local Micro Finance Institution,  to find financing for this poultry enterprise. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 F CFA to buy some chicks and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making woven garments.

loans.name: Gorethe

texts.en:
Gorethe is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old and her husband works as a driver.

For the past 12 years, she has been running a business selling green bananas.  This business has enabled her to build a house and feed her children.

She requires this loan to buy one ton of bananas that she will sell for a profit.

With the future profits she will earn, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and hopefully accumulate savings.

loans.use: to purchase green bananas to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña Maria está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, ya que con el anterior logró comprar una maquina fileteadora y ahora sus acabados han aumentado su excelencia.  Su actual credikiva lo invertirá en materias primas e insumos como telas de sabanas y de cubrelechos para seguir aplicando su creatividad y su excelente toque a productos, que está vendiendo con mucha persistencia y es que comprar en volumen le representa ahorros en la compra y también en el transporte y esto se traduce en utilidades. Ella dice que gracias a los financiadores de Kiva ha logrado avanzar y progresar,  por eso está estructurando su infraestructura, con todo  lo necesario para ejercer su actividad mercantil. Si usted quiere conocer el historial de doña Maria ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/219363
texts.en:
María is applying for her second Kiva loan since she used the previous one to buy a serger sewing machine and now her finishings have improved in excellence.  She will use her current Kiva loan to buy raw ingredients and supplies, like fabric for sheets and bedspreads, to continue applying her creativity and her excellent touch to products which are selling quite steadily because buying in bulk means savings for her and also transportation costs are lower and this translates into more profits.  

She says that thanks to the Kiva loans she’s managed to move forward and make progress.  Because of this she’s structuring the infrastructure with everything necessary to carry out her mercantile activity. 

If you’d like to learn about María’s story, please click on the following link:

http://kiva.org/lend/219363

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric for sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Sliou est un jeune marié agé de 28 ans.Il est chauffeur de transport en commun depuis 2 ans aprés avoir aché la voiture où il travaillait comme apprenti chauffeur. Il souhaitait un prêt de 150 000 FCFA dans son IMF pour acheter un moteur afin de passer des pannes qui relentissaient son activité.  Ainsi avec cet investissement il espére bien améliorer son rendement et réduire les frais de dépannage.
texts.en: Sliou is 28 years old and married. He has been a transport driver for two years after having bought the car he used while working as an apprentice driver. He would like to take out a loan of 150,000 FCFA in his IMF to buy a new motor because breakdowns are slowing down his business.  With this loan, he hopes to increase the number of customers and to lower his repair costs.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his car

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en: Jaqueline is a 31-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children, ages 3 and 6 years old. Her husband works as a technician and she sells vegetables. She has run this business for the past seven years, and the profits it has generated have enabled her to feed her family. She requires a loan so she can purchase more vegetables such as tomatoes, peanuts, and onions, that she will sell for a profit. With the future profits from her business, she plans to pay for her children’s school fees and accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell.

loans.name: Vania

texts.en: Vania is 32 years old and the single mother of one daughter who is one-and-a-half years old. She has just recently started a business in which she sells crafts such as dolls, mirrors, and knitted blankets and hats. She is asking for a loan in order to jump-start her business and purchase various crafts such as blankets, hats, little dolls, and ornamented mirrors. She is excited about her new business and desires for it to be very successful. Vania is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell such as blankets, dolls, and mirrors.

loans.name: Elida Estela

texts.es: Elida Estela: D. 43 años ella es una persona que se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, ella no cuenta que desD. ya hace varios años se dedica a este negocio,y gracias a Dios,le a ido bien en su negocio, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. frutas y verduras,el sueño D. ella es agrandar su negocio y temer mas ganancias para tener mas oportunidades en el futuro,
texts.en:
Elida Estela is 43 years old and earns her livelihood by selling fruits and vegetables. She says that she started this business several years ago and has done well thanks to God.

Elida is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can have more income and more opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en: Annonciata is a 48-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between the ages of 20 and 26. All her children are in school and she is a widow. For the past four years, she has run a business selling foodstuffs and this enterprise has helped her feed her family. She requires this loan so she can purchase 100 kg of beans and sorghum that she will sell to make a profit. With her profits, she plans to accumulate savings that will allow her to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has one son who is five years old. She is a teacher at a school for small children ages four to seven. In addition, she also runs a small store from her house on the weekends that sells various types of snacks and beverages. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more snacks and drinks such as chips, cookies, ice cream, and soft drinks. She desires to expand her business and begin selling a larger quantity of products and the loan will help her to do so. Veronica is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and beverages for her small store.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria  de 53 años de edad,  vive en  el barrio Las estrellas con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15 a 23 años;  ella en su casa tiene un restaurante y estadero, negocio  que inició hace más de 23 años , con una pequeña mesa ollas y estufa casera; Hoy no solo ha crecido su infraestructura física que ya cuenta con una cocina industrial y todo el menaje,  sino que se ha convertido en un restaurante, con 3 empleados que la ayudan a que diariamente pueda responderle a su diversa y exclusiva clientela,  con los menús que son más apetecidos.  Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores ha logrado hacer crecer su capital de trabajo, mediante su reinversión y trabajo disciplinado. El financiamiento actual está dirigido a  hacer  adecuaciones a su cocina, agregándole un mesón en lámina galvanizada, el cual es muy  higiénico y fácil de asear;  así mismo comprará más menaje y materias primas e insumos, para responderle a su creciente clientela, que muchas veces se devuelven porque la comida se ha terminado.  Mientras Gloria fortalece su sueño de ampliación de su espacio físico, para lograr el confort de los clientes y el suyo propio, maneja su negocio con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 25% , apoyando firmemente su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Gloria, 53, lives in the “Las Estrellas” neighborhood with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 15 to 23.  She has a restaurant/tavern at home, a business she started over 23 years ago with a small table, pots and a home stove.  Today, not only has its physical infrastructure grown since it now has an industrial stove and all kitchenware but it’s become a restaurant with three employees that help her meet the needs of her diverse and exclusive clientele with daily meals that are quite appealing.

Her Kiva loan is the third loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used the previous ones to increase her working capital through reinvestment and disciplined work.  The current loan will be used to do some kitchen refurbishing.  She will add a galvanized steel work table, which is more hygienic and easier to clean.  She will also buy more kitchenware and raw materials and supplies to meet growing customer demand who sometimes have to be turned away because the food has run out.  While Gloria strengthens her dream to expand her physical space to attain customer comfort, she runs the business with a profit margin of no less than 25% firmly supporting her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a galvanized steel work table, more kitchenware and raw ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Ndary

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndary est vieux cultivateur agé de 84 ans. Il nous confie avoir fait de l'agricuture depuis son jeune âge. Actuellement il compte sur ses filles, fils et beaux fils pour assurer la culture de ses quelques hectares. Il est à sa deuxième demande de crédit afin d'augmenter sa semence. Ainsi il voulait une somme de 100 000 FCFA qui servir de fonds pour l'achat de semences d'arachides.
texts.en: Mr. Ndary is an 84 year old farmer.  He tells us that he has been farming since he was very young.  Now he counts on his daughters, sons, and sons-in-law to take care of the crops in the several hectares that he owns.  He is on his second loan to help him buy more seed.  He would like a sum of 100,000 FCFA to buy peanut seed.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Orlen Rafael

texts.es:
Orlen es un hombre de 60 años nacido en la provincia de Azogues, es divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos. El es un artista plástico, quien aprendió su oficio cuando tenía 15 años de edad, nos cuenta que el pintor guayaquileño Silvio fue su maestro durante cinco años, luego el se trasladó a la ciudad de Quito cuando tenía 20 años y ahí estudió Artes Plásticas y Administración. 

Orlen ama su trabajo, tiene su propio blog en internet. Sus obras las exhibe en el Parque "El Ejido" de la ciudad de Quito, un lugar muy tradicional para los artistas ecuatorianos. Para pintar una de sus obras él busca paz y tranquilidad y por ello él trabaja a horas de la tarde y noche. Durante su tiempo libre él se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en una empresa de multinivel, esto le permite distraerse y tener contacto con muchas personas.

Ser pintor requiere numerosos gastos porque los materiales son costosos. Orlen quiere preparar obras especiales para la exposición que organizará el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores del Ecuador por lo que necesita un crédito para comprar los materiales y de esta manera porder exhibir sus obras a empresarios del exterior; así el aspira a mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir haciendo lo que tanto le apasiona.
texts.en:
Orlen, age 60, was born in the Azogues province.  He is divorced, and he has four children.  He is an artist who learned his profession when he was 15 years old.  He tells us the Guayaquileña painter, Silvio Ordoñez was his teacher for five years.  Then he moved to Quito when he was 20 years old, and he studies Plastic Arts and Administration.

Orlen loves his work. He has his own blog on the internet.  His works are on exhibit in the “El Ejido” Park in the city of Quito.  This is a very traditional place for Ecuadorian artists.  In order to paint one of his works he looks for peace and tranquility.  Therefore, he works in the afternoons and evenings.  

During his free time he sells cosmetics at a multilevel company.  This allows him to amuse himself and to have contact with a lot of people.

There are many expenses in being a painter because the materials are expensive.  Orlen wants to prepare special works for the exposition that will be organized by the Ministry of Relations Outside of Ecuador.  

He needs a loan to buy the materials.  This way he will be able to exhibit his works to companies outside of Ecuador.  He aspires to improve his quality of live and to continue doing what he is passionate about.

loans.use: to buy oil paints, fabric, and general supplies to be able to make his works of art.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino tiene 33 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen cuatro hijos y juntos residen en el centro poblado de Machente, anexo del distrito de San Francisco, donde tienen su propia casa construida a base de material rustico, adobe y techo de calamina. Faustino, aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres y a la vez trabajaba como jornalero en distintas chacras. Con sus ahorros acumulados compró su propia parcela donde viene trabajando 05 años de manera independiente y cuenta con 02 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de café y árboles maderables como el pino chuncho, caoba y entre otros.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos periódicamente. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del café por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y gracias a ello percibe buenos ingresos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la cosecha y desmonte de maleza. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes, y por ende mejorar su condición de vida. Este será su 15avo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su trabajo a la vez agradece y solicita el apoyo de los financistas para sobre salir adelante. En su banco comunal es un joven que aporta ideas para el progreso de su grupo comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles contratará mano ajena para que lo apoyen en las cosecha y desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
Faustino is 33 years old.  He lives with his partner and they have four children.  They live together in the village of Machente, an annex of San Francisco district.  They own their own home which is built from 'rustic' building materials (adobe).  The roof is made from corrugated metal.

Even when he was still a teenager, Faustino worked on his parents' land.  He also worked as a laborer on other people's farms.  He saved up some money and bought his own plot of land where he has been working independently for the past five years.  He has two hectares of land planted with coffee plants and timber-producing trees such as 'pino chuncho' (a native tree), mahogany, etc.  The key to his success lies in his creativity and his desire to work.  He uses modern technology in growing his plants because he receives periodic training from agricultural engineers.

Faustino's product which is in greatest demand is his coffee beans, owing to the quality of the product that he sells.  It makes him good financial income.  Normally he works alone but during harvest times he hires laborers so that he can pick and select his product more quickly.  He will use the loan he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting and weeding.  His plan for the future is to continue expanding his production so that he can continue satisfying his customers and thereby improve his living conditions.

This is Faustino's 15th loan from MFP.  He knows that the loan will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is grateful and requests the support of Kiva lenders in helping him to get ahead.  He is a young man who contributes ideas to his community bank which help his group to make progress.  He will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting and weeding.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Harapan Baru 15 Group

texts.en: To rent a place for a business is quite expensive in Jakarta. So, using the house as a place to run the business is the cheapest way, that's what Wati does. Wati is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and her children (4) in Cilincing. She sells snacks and drinks like es campur and palu butung. To expand her business she needs more ingredients and she requested 3,000,000 Indonesia Rupiah. She prepare expansion especially for this Ramadhan time, she believe this time she can increase her income. Her focus is for her children education, she want to send all of them to college.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, flour, eggs, ice, etc.

loans.name: Marilu  Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marilu;  tiene 41 años de edad  y es casada la socia tiene 3 hijos;  La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y venta leña al por mayor y menor, la socia compra arboles y los cortan para leña, la socia también se dedica  a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes,  la socia también compra, cría y vende pollos, la socia ocupa todo su tiempo en trabajar y producir para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y así poder pagar sus mensualidades de colegio, estudios y pagos de servicios de la casa al igual que la alimentación y salud de sus hijos; La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de arboles una parte, otra en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y otros productos al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y comprar arboles para la leña.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marilú, 41, belongs to the “Vilcanota” communal bank that belongs to Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is married and has three children.  She’s a retailer.  She buys and sells firewood at wholesale and retail.  She buys trees that are chopped for firewood.  She also runs her grocery store.  In addition, she buys chickens to raise and then resell.  She occupies all her time working and producing to provide her family with a better quality of life and to be able to pay the monthly school tuition fees, home utility bills, her children’s food and health costs.  

She wants to use the loan partly to buy trees and partly to buy stock merchandise for the store: rice, sugar, milk, oil and other products at wholesale.  

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock the store and to buy trees for firewood.  She is grateful for and values the loan that will be granted to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store and trees to make firewood.

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyara Kwetungura Group B

texts.en:
34-year-old Enid is a retail businesswoman who plies her trade in Rukungiri town in western Uganda. The mother of three began her business 10 years ago with savings from her farming business. The farming business, which she runs on the side, is pivotal to her business in the sense that she reinvests most of her food sales profits into her retail business. This means she constantly restocks her retail business with commodities when demand is high at her shop and when she is running short on commodities. This is one factor that helps her business stand in such a good stead and makes her confident about the future prospects of her trade. This, in combination with her diligence and will power, are sure shot winning calling cards. Enid also does some goat and pig husbandry. Monthly, she says, this business generates her sales revenue totaling up to Ugandan shillings 150,000.
With this Kiva loan, Enid says she is going to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour, etc to sell

loans.name: Maria Romelia

texts.es: Maria Romelia. es casada tiene dos hijos menores de edad uno de 2 años y la pequeña tiene 4 meses su esposo actualmente trabaja en la fabrica de sueteres, ella se dedica a la venta de sueteres, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de sueteres,su sueño es incrementar sus ventas y tener un negocio mas grande tambien para mejorar su casa ya que sus hijos son pequeños todavia y cuando sean grandes darles todo lo necesarios,para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Romelia is married and has two young children, a two-year-old and a four-month-old. Her husband currently works at a sweater factory while she earns an income by selling sweaters.

Maria Romelia is requesting this loan in order to buy sweaters. Her dream is to increase her sales and have a larger business so that she can improve her house while her children are still small. When they grow up, she can provide them everything they need for their studies.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Miyelsis  Patricia

texts.es:
Miyelsi de 27 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años de edad en Simón Bolívar, un barrio muy tradicional, que combina alegría, dinamismo, educación y escenarios culturales, como cuando  su reconocido  boulevard se prepara anualmente,  para dar paso a los tradicionales desfiles del carnaval de Barranquilla.  En este ambiente de gente trabajadora y educada  tiene su negocio de vender mercancía a crédito Miyelsi desde hace dos años , sus clientes son los vecinos de  Simón Bolívar y sus barrios aledaños entre los que se encuentra , costa hermosa, las palmeras, amigos, familiares, y referidos;  los productos que vende son, ropa en general y telas por metros.  
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía como jeans, suéteres, tela de dril, tela de lino, sandalias y camisas, con el fin de seguir expandiendo su negocio. Sus estados financieros  están acordes con la actividad de su negocio, las ventas cubren sus gastos familiares y le generan una utilidad con las que fácilmente cubre su obligación. Su negocio es producto de su experiencia en el trabajo, pues hace 11 años fue vendedora en almacenes ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla y ganó mucho conocimiento, el cual se convirtió en su gran fortaleza para el desempeño actual de su microempresa. Con su negocio apoya a su cónyuge en los gastos del hogar, pues ambos están muy de acuerdo en que cada día trabajarán persistentemente, para aumentar su bienestar familiar, En la actualidad sus esfuerzos han logrado generar en su negocio una rentabilidad del 38,74%, mientras sus  cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 26 días, su nivel de autonomía es de un  100% y la  rotación de inventarios es de cada 10 días. Su meta más adelante es terminar de adecuar su vivienda y tener un local comercial bien posicionado y prosperó que ayude a sacar adelante a su hijo,  especialmente en los estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Miyelsis is 27 years old and lives with her partner and her 3-year-old child in Simón Bolívar. The neighborhood is very traditional combining joy, dynamism, education and cultural scenes. Every year the neighborhood’s well-known boulevard is set up for the traditional Carnival parades of Barranquilla. It is in this ambience of hard working and educated people that Miyelsi has had her business of selling merchandise on credit for two years. Her customers are her neighbors from Simón Bolivar and bordering neighborhoods such as Costa Hermosa and Las Palmeras, and among them are friends, relatives and referrals. The products she sells include general clothing and fabric by the meter.  

She is currently applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy merchandise like jeans, sweaters, drill and linen fabrics, sandals and shirts in order to continue expanding her business. Her financial situation is in tune with the business’ activity. Her sales cover her family expenses and generate enough profit to easily cover her loan obligation. Her business is the product of her work experience. Eleven years ago she was a salesperson in wholesalers located in the center of Barranquilla. There she gained a lot of experience which she transferred into a great strength in running her microbusiness. 

She helps her partner with the household expenses through her business. Both of them are in agreement that each day they will work persistently to improve the wellbeing of their family. Her current efforts have produced a profitability of 38.74% in the business while her accounts payable turnover is every 26 days. She has 100% autonomy and she has a 10 day inventory turnover. Her goal is to finish fixing up her house and acquire a commercial space that is well positioned and prosperous so that she can help her child get ahead especially in professional studies.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like jeans, sweaters, drill and linen fabric, sandals and shirts in order to  continue expanding her business.

loans.name: Americo

texts.en: Americo is 76 years old and married with three children. He is retired and enjoys spending more time with his family. He is asking for a loan to make improvements to his house. Specifically, he wants to add to the office he has in his house. He plans to purchase paint, wood panels, and other materials he may need to renovate his office. Americo is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood panels, and other supplies to renovate the office in his house

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 53 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Ángel de 52 años y sus 03 hijos a quienes les brinda educación justa y adecuada. Sabina es una mujer muy trabajadora, se despierta muy temprano para preparar el alimento para los miembros de su familia para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores. La tienda de abarrotes de Sabina es una de las más visitadas de su centro poblado, debido al gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato y eso ha hecho que sea la preferida por los habitantes del poblado de Machente, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad que encontraran en dicha tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 12 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado comprará más provisiones para su tienda. Más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la más preferida y concurrida de su comunidad. Este será su 17avo crédito y necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por ser parte de su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mercadería como sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en: Sabina, 53, is a friendly and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband, Angel, who is 52, and their 3 children.  They are providing their children with a good education that is appropriate for their needs.  Sabina is a very hardworking woman who gets up very early to prepare food for the members of her family.  Later she goes to open the doors of her business to await her first customers.  Sabina's grocery store is one of the busiest in her village owing to her great charm and the friendliness of her service, which has made her business popular amongst the inhabitants of the village of Machente.  Sabina's customers don't hesitate to shop at her store, because they know that the store has a great variety of basic consumer goods.  What Sabina likes most about her work is to chat with her customers.  She has had this business for 12 years, and what she considers most difficult is having to stay on her feet all day.  With the support of the loan she requests, she will buy more products for her store.  In the future, she hopes to grow her business and have it become the most popular and busiest business in her community.  This will be her 17th loan, and she needs the support of the lenders so that she can reach her goal.  Also, she is committed to complying with the payment terms of the loan, and is grateful to be a part of her communal bank.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested, she will buy more merchandise such as: sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, preserves, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, preserves, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Gian Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven trabajador de 22 años que vive con sus padres y hermanos en la comunidad rural del distrito de  Razuri en Ascope. Marvin es un joven que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Marvin ofrece su servicios  de codificación de sacos de harina en las fábricas de su comunidad. Él cuenta con sus propias herramientas de trabajo y su servicio es muy solicitado por las empresas. Marvin tiene muchos deseos de superación y su familia lo apoya en las actividades que este realiza para cumplir sus metas.

Marvin desea invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar su trabajo y cumplir con  sus pedidos y contratos. Por ello solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para poder adquirirlos.

 Marvin ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y su crédito anterior fue cancelado con puntualidad y responsabilidad. Su negocio ha ido creciendo grancias a nuestra ayuda financiera y Marvin quiere continuar con ese buen camino.
texts.en:
Marvin, 22, is a young worker living with his parents and siblings in the rural community of Razuri District in Ascope.  Marvin is a young man who enjoys good personal and work-related references.

Marvin provides a flour sack codification service to factories in his community.  He has his own work tools and his services are highly sought after by the firms.  Marvin very much wants to get ahead and his family supports his efforts in the activities he does to reach his goals.

Marvin wants to buy materials needed to do his job and fill his requests and contracts.  Because of this he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to be able to acquire them.

Marvin has worked with our firm previously and his last loan was repaid punctually and responsibly.  His business has been growing thanks to our financial help and Marvin wants to stay on this good path.

loans.use: to buy flour sack codification tools.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenón tiene 31 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos, Juan y Jonathan de 03 y 01 año de edad. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa construida a base de madera y techo de calamina. Zenón, vive en uno de los centros poblados más competentes dentro del distrito de San Francisco, el centro poblado de Machente se caracteriza por ser una urbe de negocios por ser el eje de dos ciudades entre San Francisco y Ayacucho. Él menciona que si hay varios negocios del mismo rubro, es un negocio que funciona, desde luego que cuando abrió su restaurante, sabía lo que hacia, pero no tuvo miedo a la competencia, es mas trato de competir ante ellos y aplico la estrategia de prestar un buen servicio y comida al gusto del cliente. Ante esto, trata de mejorar continuamente en cuanto a la preparación de sus potajes y ofrecer un acogedor lugar en su local. En cuanto a su trabajo cuenta el apoyo de su pareja y a la vez tiene un ayudante quien se encarga de la limpieza. Zenon espera éste crédito, para poder comprarse mesas, sillas y adornos florales, ya que desea brindar una buena atención a sus concurrentes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su restaurante, con la necesidad de que albergue mayor capacidad de clientela y por ende puede tener más ganancias. Este será su quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y  por ello espera contar con el mismo apoyo de todos ustedes ya que gracias al apoyo de ello trata de mejorar su condición de vida. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar mesas, sillas y adornos florales, para acondicionar su negocio.
texts.en: Zenon, 31, lives with a partner and has 2 children, Juan and Jonathan, who are 3 and 1 years old, respectively.  They live together in the town of Machente, located on the edge of the Peruvian rainforest, where they have built their own home out of wood and metal roofing material.  Zenon lives in one of the most accomplished towns in the San Francisco district.  The town of Machente is known as a center for business, because it is the axis between the two cities of San Francisco and Ayacucho.  Zenon mentions that if there are a number of businesses in the same line of work, it is a business that works.  Of course, when he opened his restaurant, he knew what he was doing, but he wasn't afraid of the competition.  It was more that he wanted to try to compete with them and apply a strategy to provide good service and food to the customers' liking.  Given this, he tries to continually improve in terms of the preparation of his dishes and making his restaurant a welcoming place.  In his work, he has the support of his partner and  he also has an assistant who is in charge of the cleaning.  Zenon awaits this loan, so that he can buy tables, chairs, and floral decorations, since he wants to provide good service to his guests.  In the future, he plans to expand his restaurant, and will need a bigger space to accommodate a larger number of customers and therefore have greater earnings.  This will be his 5th loan with MFP, and he has always been very punctual with his payments because he hopes to be able to rely on the same support from all of you.  Thanks to this support, he is trying to improve his living standards.  With the loan that he requests, he will be able to buy tables, chairs and floral decorations for his business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and floral decorations

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Neri;  tiene 47 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia tiene 4 hijos;  La socia trabaja en el área administrativa en Chinchero, ella es empleada del ministerio público, la socia paralelamente a esto en sus ratos libres y con el apoyo de sus familia atiende su restaurante  “Pintacha”, la socia también se dedica a apoyar a sus conyugue en la carpintería, ella los fines de semana y cuando puede ve los acabados, los pedidos y los cobros de la carpintería que su conyugue administra y trabaja. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de  menajería para el restaurante y la compra de platos, cubiertos que siempre se requiere sustituir y aumentar, también los ingredientes y comprar aceite por bidones, papa, arroz, entre lo que más sale y con otra parte pagar la compra de madera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera y en la compra de menajería y de víveres para el restaurante. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Neri, 47, is a member of the “Vilcanota” communal bank which belongs to Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She works in the administrative department of the public prosecutor’s office in Chinchero.  In her free time and with help from her family she runs her restaurant “Pintacha.”  She also helps out her spouse with the carpentry: on weekends and when she can she checks over the finishings, orders and payments at the carpentry shop her spouse runs and works.

On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy kitchenware for the restaurant, to buy dishes and cutlery that always need to be replaced and increased.  She will also buy ingredients and large containers of oil, rice and potatoes among the items that are used the most.  She will use another part of it to buy lumber.  She is asking for the loan to buy lumber, kitchenware and foodstuffs for the restaurant.

She is grateful for and values the loan that will be granted to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lumber, kitchenware and foodstuffs for the restaurant.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es:
Omar tiene 28 años de edad  y es padre de un pequeño hijo. En su comunidad se le conoce por ser un joven honrado y trabajador, que tiene muchos deseos de superarse. Vive en casa con su madre en el distrito de Castilla – Piura. 

Omar se dedica a la producción y comercialización de chifles. La ciudad de Piura es famosa por sus deliciosos chifles, que son snakcs de plátanos fritos (chips). Omar cuenta con este negocio desde hace 3 años y los desarrolla en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Omar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar los insumos que la preparación de sus chifles necesita. La demanda de Omar ha aumentado y es por ello que se  ha visto en la necesidad de  solicitar el crédito. 

Omar es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, y ha cancelado adecuadamente sus pagos. Es un hombre que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Omar, 28, has a little son.  He is known in his community for being a hard working, honest young man who very much wants to get ahead.  He lives at home with his mother in Castilla-Piura District.

Omar makes “chifles” to sell.  Piura is a city famous for its delicious chifles which are snacks made from fried bananas (chips).  Omar has had the business for the last three years and he makes them at home.  He has a well established clientele in the area.

Omar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy ingredients needed for the chifle production.  Omar’s demand has increased and this is why he finds himself in need of requesting the loan.

Omar is a repeat client of our firm and has repaid his loans adequately.  He is a man who enjoys good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make "chifles" (fried banana chips).

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary  vive en el municipio de Soledad y en su condición de viuda tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 21 a 25 años. Ella se dedica a la producción de uniformes de oficina y especiales anti fluidos que son utilizados en clínicas y hospitales lo cual funciona con contactos de su hijo que es médico, y su hija quien es auxiliar de vuelo. Mary para iniciar su negocio contó con mucha experiencia en el sector de las confecciones, ya que trabajó durante un tiempo con importantes diseñadoras de la ciudad.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domino, con el comprará una maquina fileteadora. Realizar adecuaciones locativas a su negocio y comprar telas, hilos botones y correderas, para aumentar la calidad de sus productos y el volumen de producción.
El negocio de Mary muestra sus los estados financieros  con buenas condiciones para la inversión, ya que el volumen de ventas es compensado por calidad y precio;  además de manejar cuentas por cobrar de sus clientes que ya son fijos, y de las confecciones sobre medida que le solicitan clientes en su propio barrio. Los indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio, y condiciones favorables para la inversión. Su sueño es lograr el pleno crecimiento de su negocio, lo mismo que una sostenibilidad futura que responda totalmente al aumento de su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mary lives in the town of Soledad.  She is a widow and has three children aged 21 to 25.  Mary makes work uniforms and especially medical uniforms which are used in clinics and hospitals.  She works with contacts from her son, who is a doctor, and her daughter, who is a flight attendent.  Mary already had a lot of experience in the dressmaking field when she set up her business as she worked for some time with important designers in the city.  This Kiva loan is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy an overlock sewing machine, to carry out some structural work and to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and zippers, to increase the quality of her products and her production volume.

Mary's business shows good financial conditions for this investment since her sales volume is offset by her quality and price.  She also manages accounts receivable from regular customers as well as from the custom-made pieces that customers in her own neighborhood request.  Her financial indicators show a stability in her business and favorable conditions for investment.  Her dream is to manage to fully grow her business and have a future sustainability that reflects an increase in her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, to carry out some structural work and to buy fabric, threads, buttons and zippers

loans.name: Viviana Fenes

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. Viviana es una madre trabajadora y dedicada a su familia.  Ella tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Viviana se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Ella los cría en la parte trasera de su casa y una vez que alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa a los pobladores de la zona y en el mercado de su comunidad. Sin embargo, el negocio que más rentabilidad le da , es el cultivo de mango y limón. Viviana cuenta con terreno agrícola que su padre le heredó es allí donde  tiene sus cosechas. 

Viviana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles para invertir en sus negocios. Comprará alimento balanceado para sus ovinos , así como , fertilizantes para sus cultivos de limón y mango. 

Viviana es una clienta conocida de nuestra entidad y ha sido puntual en sus pagos
texts.en:
Viviana, 27, lives with her husband and two children in her own house located in the rural community of Tambogrande-Piura District.  Viviana is a hard working mother who is devoted to her family.  She has a strong wish to improve her children’s quality of life.

Viviana raises sheep to sell.  She raises them in her back yard and once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them to local residents and at her community’s market.  However, the business that’s most profitable is growing lemons and mangoes.  Viviana has a field that her father passed down to  her where she grows her crops.

Viviana is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to invest in her businesses.  She will buy nutritionally balanced feed for her sheep as well as fertilizer for her lemon and mango crops.

Viviana is a well known client of our firm and has been punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk for making tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Griselda, vive con su familia, su esposo y una hija de 15 años de edad, ella tiene un año dedicándose al negocio de accesorios  y ha logrado sobrevivir de los ingresos que le provee.
Por el momento necesita comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio, pues necesita pulseras, poster animados, calcomanías, accesorios para el cabello y más productos que son del gusto de los jóvenes, pues su mercado principal son precisamente la juventud y los niños.
Su objetivo con el negocio es tener lo necesario para atender la demanda, esperando contar con clientela que le consuma y le genere ganancias.
texts.en:
Griselda lives with her family, her husband and 15 year old daughter.  She has been running an accessory business for a year now and has been able to survive on the income it provides.   At the moment she needs to buy merchandise to stock her business.  She needs bracelets, animated posters, stickers, hair accessories and more products that young people like as her main customers are young people and children.  

He business goal is to have what she needs to meet the demand.  She hopes to have customers that will buy and generate income.

loans.use: purchase bracelets, animated posters, stickers, hair accessories and more.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
María tiene 27 años de edad,  es una mujer con muchas aspiraciones y empeñosa en sus labores. María vive en una comunidad de condición humilde del distrito de Mórrope en Chiclayo. Goza de buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.

María se dedica desde hace tres años al comercio de ropa. Ella cuenta con clientela establecida que constantemente  , solicita sus productos . Ella realiza esta actividad desde su domicilio y su demanda ha aumentado. 

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en su negocio. Ella desea comprar prendas de vestir que ya tiene pedidas y otras para renovar su stock.  Las comunidades que se encuentran alrededor de la de María, están en épocas de feria  y ella quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para ofrecer allí sus productos, es por ello que necesita renovarlos.

María es una clienta de nuestra entidad que goza de un excelente historial crediticio, es muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
María, age 27, is a woman with many aspirations, and she is diligent about her work.  María lives under humble conditions in a community in the Mórrope district in Chiclayo.  She has good references, as much personal as for her work. 

María has been selling clothes for three years.  She has established customers who regularly request her products.  She works from home, and her demand has increased.

María is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to invest in her business.  She wants to buy garments that she now has orders for and others to renew her stock.

The communities around Maria’s are having seasonal fairs.  She wants to take advantage of this opportunity to sell her products there.  That is why she needs to replenish her stock.

María is a client of our institution, and she enjoys an excellent credit history.  She is very responsible with her payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes for current orders and to restock.

loans.name: Kpedetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEDETIN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Comlan Gratien est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Comlan Gratien est âgé de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Comlan Gratien est marié à une ménagère du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Comlan Gratien a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Comlan Gratien a appris le métier de soudure. Comlan Gratien mène cette activité depuis douze ans ennvirons. Comlan Gratien s’approvisionne en matériaux de soudure dans l’une des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Comlan Gratien sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEDETIN, un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The KPEDETIN group is composed of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. It is the second time that this group is requesting a loan from  ALIDé, to raise the level of their businesses. The representative of the group, Comlan Gratien, is the one who is raising his hand in the photo. 

Comlan Gratien, 46, lives in Bénin. He is married to a housewife named Jeanne. The couple have two children, both enrolled in school, and both under their roof. 

Comlan Gratien did not attend school very much. To support himself and his children, he learned the trade of welding. He has been working at this trade for about 12 years. He buys his welding materials in a town in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy his clientele and grow his turnover and thus his income, he is requesting his second loan together with the members of his group, KPEDETIN. The first loan was correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy gas for welding.

loans.name: Roger Neville

texts.es: Roger Neville tiene 69 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de imprenta. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio como herencia de parte de sus padres quienes le dejaron a cargo este medio de vida fue así que Roger lucho todos los días por mantener el negocio, ahora tiene una gran variedad de clientes que llegan a solicitar de sus servicios. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para la compra de papel, guillotina, grapas, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Roger Neville, age 69, provides printing services.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He started the business as an inheritance from his parents.  They left him in charge of this way of life.  Roger struggled every day to maintain the business.

He now has a great variety of customers who come to request his services.  The loan that he is currently requesting is to buy paper, a paper cutter, and staples, among other products.

loans.use: to buy paper, a paper cutter, and staples, among other products.

loans.name: Teobaldo Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso es un joven trabajador de 28 años de edad. Esta casado y  vive con su esposa e hijo en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en la parte rural de este. La vivienda de Alonso no cuenta con los servicios básicos de saneamiento.

Alonso se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra limón semanalmente en una parcela que su padre le heredó. Además, Alonso  cuenta con una mototaxi (moto con cabina en la parte trasera para trasladar pasajeros), en la que brinda un servicio de transporte público. Estas actividades le permiten mantener a su familia y Alonso desea continuar con el buen desarrollo de ellas para tener mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.

Alonso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar los fertilizantes que sus cultivos  de limón requieren , así como, para el mantenimiento de los asientos y rodajes de su mototaxi.

Alonso es un hombre responsable y este crédito le sería de mucha utilidad.
texts.en:
Alonso is a hard-working 28 year old young man.  He is married, and he lives with his wife and child in his own house in the rural eastern part of the Tambogrande – Piura district.  Alonso’s house does not have the basic sanitation services.

Alonso is a farmer.  He plants lemons weekly on a piece of land that his father left him.  Also, Alonso has a “mototaxi” (a motorcycle with a cabin in the back for transporting passengers).  He offers public transportation services.  These business activities allow him to support his family.  Alsonso wishes to continue the good progress of his businesses.  He wants to do this to have greater income that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

Alonso is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizers that his lemon crops need.  He will also have repairs done on the seats and wheels of his mototaxi.

Alonso is a responsible man, and this loan would be very useful to him.

loans.use: to repair the seats and wheels of his "mototaxi" (three wheeled motorized vehicle).

loans.name: Jesuwame Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUWAME est composé de quatre personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Michel est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Michel est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Michel est marié à une ménagère du nom de Clémence. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Michel a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Michel a appris le métier d'électricien. Michel mène cette activité depuis huit ans  ennvirons. Michel s’approvisionne en articles d'électricité dans l’une des villes du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Michel sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWAME, un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group JESUWAME is composed of four persons who lives in the same district. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to raise their level of business.  The group’s representative, named Michel, is the one with his hand raised in the photo. He is 37 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a homemaker named Clémence. They have three children, who are all in school and in their care. 

Michel had little schooling. To support himself and his children, he learned  to be an electrician as a trade. He has been in this business for about eight years. He stocks up on electrical goods in one of the cities in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his turnover and his revenues, Michel and the other members of his group JESUWAME are requesting a second loan. The first one was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group
