Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente a suplir sus necesidades y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casa.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
María Margoth, 25, is single living with her parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration) communal bank are located in Achoveta that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

María is a corn and rice farmer.  She purchases her supplies in Agripac and her sales take place at the Carlos Castillo supply center.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs and improve the farming activities.  Her dream is to finish her schooling and buy herself a house.

She enjoys working in the countryside and doing household chores.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Roberto Vinicio

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven de 32 años soltero que vive en la parroquia de Tumbaco en la ciudad de Quito. Hace tres años puso su negocio en la parroquia Pifo en el barrio "La Libertad". Es propietario de un local que brinda servicio de llamadas telefónicas, internet y además vende accesorios para teléfonos celular.

La jornada de Roberto es larga, al ser propietario de su negocio debe estar desde la apertura hasta el cierre todos los días, de 7am a 7pm. Tomó varios cursos para poder brindar el servicio de reparación de celulares, por lo que ahora necesita comprar repuestos y herramientas para poder hacerlo. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar un crédito que le permita ampliar su negocio, él dará servicio de reparación a sus clientes y además comprará más accesorios para ofertar.

Nos cuenta que ha sido muy difícil empezar ya que ha tenido dificultad en conseguir capital de trabajo al ser un negocio nuevo pero ahora él se considera bien enrumbado y seguro de que podrá hacer que su negocio crezca. Él desea mejorar su calidad de vida, incrementar sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto is 32 years old and single.  He lives in the Tumbaco parish in the city of Quito.  Three years ago he set up his business in the Pifo parish in the La Libertad neighborhood.  He is the proprietor of a place that offers services for phone calls and the internet.  He also sells cell phone accessories.  

Robert’s work day is long.  As the proprietor of his business he has to be there from opening until closing every day from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m.  He took various courses to be able to offer the service of repairing cell phones.

However, he now needs to buy the replacement parts and the tools to be able to do so.  He went to the Fundación Alternativa to request a loan that will allow him to expand his business.  He will provide repair services to his customers, and he will also buy more accessories to sell.

He tells us that it has been very difficult to start because he had difficulty getting working capital as it was a new business.  Now he considers himself to be well on his way.  He is sure that he will be able to make his business grow.  

He wishes to improve his quality of live, increase his income, and to be able to help his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Nelly Margoth

texts.es:
Nelly Margoth tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Nelly se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el Comercial Carlos Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente a suplir sus necesidades y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Nelly Margoth is 22 years old.  She and single and lives with her parents in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province. 

The members of the communal bank Nueva Inspiracion (New Inspiration) are located in the Anchoveta Precinct of Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural projects, like growing corn and rice.

Nelly makes her living in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She purchases her products from Agripac and sells them in the Carlos Castillo Stores.

Nelly is requesting the loan to purchase corn seed.  The loan would help her financially to meet her needs and to improve her agricultural activities.  She faces challenges such as plant diseases like "cinta roja" (an emerging disease known as "red stripe") in the corn.  Nelly's dream is to purchase a plot of land.

Nelly likes housework.

loans.use: to purchase corn and rice seed.

loans.name: Carmen Marlene

texts.es:
Carmen Marlene  tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con su esposo y sus hijos Margarita, Leydy, Alexandra, Hismael y Widinson, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Carmen  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas y en Carlos Chino.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz, abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El crédito le ayudará a suplir sus necesidades económicas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprar una finca y aumentar los ingresos.

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Carmen Marlene, 27, is married living with her husband and children, Margarita, Leydy, Alexandra, Hismael and Widinson in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration) communal bank are located in Achoveta that belongs to Pueblo Viejo Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Carmen is a corn and rice farmer.  She purchases her supplies in Agripac and her sales take place at the Ventanas wholesale market and in Carlos Chino.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds, manure and farming supplies for the crops.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs. She faces such challenges as crop illnesses, like red stripe, in the corn.  Her dream is to buy a farm and increase her income.

She enjoys doing household chores.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, manure and farming supplies.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Del Bosque Group

texts.es: El señor Eddy quien pertenece al alcom La Nueva Esperanza del Bosque, tiene 31 años y vive en las Lomas D. Carabayllo, es conviviente y recientemente a tenido a su primogenito, se dedica a la compra y venta D. materiales D. construccion,trabaja en Transportes R., empezo junto con sus hermanos, al inicio adquirieron un vehiculo y en la actualidad ya cuentan con tres vehiculos. Hasta el momento el señor Eddy ha logrado estabilidad economica, su negocio cubre todas las deudas D. su hogar. Su deseo es poder sacar adelante a su familia y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Eddy is a member of the Communal Bank “La Nueva Esperanza del Bosque” (The New Hope of the Forest). He is 31 years old and lives in Las Lomas D. Carabayllo. Eddy is in a common-law relationship and his first child was recently born. He buys and sells construction materials. Eddy works in a business called “Transportes R.”, which he started with his siblings. He started out with one vehicle, but now he has three of them.

Sr. Eddy has reached the point where has achieved financial stability. His business allows him to cover all of his household obligations. He hopes to move his family forward and continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yesenia, se dedica al comercio de tamales y cosméticos, está casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, tiene 5 años de comercializar con los cosméticos, lo inicio junto a su esposo, trabajan de 7:00am a 4:00pm. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de lociones y cosméticos como maquillajes, labiales, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer al cliente todo lo necesario para satisfacer los gustos.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio competente, mejorar sus ventas y sobre todo las ganancias para su familia, ayudando a sus hijos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yesenia sells tamales and cosmetics. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 2 and 5. Yesenia has been selling cosmetics for five years. She started this business with her husband and they work from 7am to 4pm.

Yesenia is currently requesting a loan to buy lotions and cosmetics, such as makeup and lipsticks. This loan will help strengthen her business and offer her customers everything they need to satisfy their tastes.

Her goals are to maintain a competitive business, improve her sales, provide her family what they need, and help her children with everything.

loans.use: to buy lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alicia Alexandra

texts.es:
Alicia Alexandra tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y su hija Abigaíl, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Alicia se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el Comercial Carlos Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. El crédito le ayudará a suplir sus necesidades económicas. y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.

Le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Alicia Alexandra is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents and her daughter Abigail in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Inspiracion” (New Inspiration) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Anchoveta, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Alicia is a farmer who grow and rice. She buys her supplies at AGRIPAC and then sells her products at the Carlos Castillo Commercial Center.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting corn. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in her farming activities. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Alicia enjoys traveling.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting corn.

loans.name: Wilma Mariana

texts.es:
Wilma Mariana tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Wilma se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el Comercial Carlos Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. El crédito le ayudará a suplir sus necesidades económicas. y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos entre las cuales está la cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Wilma Mariana is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Inspiracion” (New Inspiration) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Anchoveta, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Wilma is a farmer who grow and rice. She buys her supplies at AGRIPAC and then sells her products at the Carlos Castillo Commercial Center.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting corn. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in her farming activities. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Wilma enjoys completing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting corn.

loans.name: Litzi Ericka

texts.es: La Señora Litzi Ericka tiene un hijo bajo su dependencia y ha cursado hasta el nivel universitario;  estudió en la universidad estatal;  actualmente  ella se separó de su esposo y tiene que sobre llevar sus problemas sola; porque no tiene  apoyo  para que  cuiden de su hijo que apenas  tiene  5 años de vida.  La señora quiere comenzar  a trabajar independientemente para tener más libertad en sus actividades cotidianas  y poder educarle personalmente a su pequeño,  por esta razón recurrió para que le otorguemos un crédito y pueda alquilar un lugar y desarrollar su profesión como dentista.
texts.en:
Sra. Litzi Ericka has one dependent child. She attended the state university and completed her studies, but is now separated from her husband. Therefore, she must now take care of her problems alone because she no longer has support for taking care of her five-year-old.

Sra. Litzi Ericka wants to work independently so that she will have more freedom in her daily activities and still be able to take care of the educational needs of her little one. For this reason, she has resorted to requesting a loan so that she can rent a place where she can develop in her profession as a dentist.

loans.use: to rent a location for her dentistry practice.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, vive junto a una nieta de 11 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace dos años aproximadamente, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, pero hoy en dia lo realiza como un medio de subsistencia para ella y le permite también ayudar a su nieta.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de tortillas, el riesgo de este negocio es que el maíz suba de precio y no le permita generar ganancia.
Ella quiere mantenerse en el negocio, que a través de financiamientos pueda aumenta la producción y generar una mayor estabilidad para su nieta y que también pueda apoyarla para estudiar.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 11 year old granddaughter.  Rosa has been selling tortillas for approximately two years.  She learned this trade when she was very little.  However, now she does it as the means to her livelihood.  It also allows her to help her granddaughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood.  This purchase will help her to have the necessary materials to make and sell tortillas.  The risk in this business is that the price of corn goes up, and it does not allow her to generate income.  She wants to stay in the business.  With the loan she is able to increase production and generate greater stability for her granddaughter.  She will also be able to support her education.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business of making tortillas.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos, ella vende de forma ambulante desde hace 7 meses, normalmente ofrece ropa para caballeros, damas y niños, sale a los caseríos a vender la mercadería. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones jeans, blusas y ropa interior, con esta inversión le ayudara a mantener variedad de prendas de vestir, comprando por mayoreo obtendrá mejores precios para que al momento de vender obtenga una mayor ganancia.
Su sueño es tener un local fijo, propio en el centro de la ciudad, para descanzar un poco y estar más cerca y pendiente de su familia, además de que también quiere tener una vivienda propia para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a clothes merchant.  She lives with her husband and four children.  She’s been a street vendor for the last 7 months.  Normally, she stocks men’s, women’s and children’s clothes.  She goes out to the hamlets to sell the merchandise.

She is asking for a loan to buy jeans, blouses and underwear.  This investment will help her have a variety of articles of clothing on hand.   She’ll pay better prices buying at wholesale so that when she resells, profits will be higher.

Her dream is to have a fixed locale downtown to rest a bit and be closer to and more watchful of her family.  Besides, she’d also like to have a house of her own to live in with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: Cinthya tiene 26 años, es soltera y madre de un niño de dos años, vive en casa de su madre junto a ella. El trabajo de Cinthya consiste en la venta de comida y bebidas heladas, pero mas que la venta de comida, su trabajo consiste en dar pensión a trabajadores que hay por su casa ya que vive por un lugar que es muy concurrido. Tiene 10 años en este trabajo, y recuerda que desde muy niña su mamá le enseñó todo y desde entonces realiza esta actividad junto a ella. Le gusta todo de su trabajo pues esta contenta por que puede disponer de su tiempo, a ella le gustaría poder agrandar su local y empezar un negocio ella sola, pues cree que también es bueno siempre empezar a hacer las cosas solas para adquirir más responsabilidades. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, espera poder seguir siendo responsable ya que siempre se considero así. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, desea comprar bebidas gasificadas para su venta, además comprar ingredientes para seguir trabajando con la venta de comida.
texts.en: Cinthya is 26 years old, is single and the mother of a two-year old child.  She lives together with her mother in her mother's home.  Cinthya's work consists of selling food and cold beverages.  But more than food sales, her work is providing lodging for workers, since she lives in a place that is very crowded.  She has been doing this work for 10 years.  She recalls that when she was a very young girl, her mother started teaching her everything.  Since then, she has worked together with her mother.  She likes everything about her work.  She is happy because she has time at her disposal.  Cinthya would like to make her food stall bigger and focus on being in business for herself.  She believes it is always good to start new things by oneself to take on more responsibility.  This is Cinthya's fifth loan with MFP.  She hopes to continue being responsible, since she has always been known for being so.  With the amount she has requested, 1000 soles ($375 USD), she hopes to purchase more sodas to sell.  In addition, she wants to purchase ingredients to keep working selling food.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 45 años de edad, ella es separada de su esposo, tiene un hijo y vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande. Marisol vive en la parte céntrica del distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos

Marisol cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio  la cual es atendida permanentemente  por ella misma cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona, ella vende básicamente productos de primera necesidad, así como también abarrotes, verduras, carnes y cerveza.

Marisol esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder comprar mercadería  como es la compra de abarrotes en cantidad mayor y productos novedosos para sus negocio de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos 

Marisol presenta buena voluntad y muchas ganas de salir adelante , de seguir creciendo en su negocio, además las personas que la conocen , la describen como una persona muy trabajadora, responsable  y de buen carácter.
texts.en:
Marisol is 45 years old and separated from her husband. She has a son and lives at the home of her parents, which is located in the District of Tambogrande. Marisol resides in the central part of the district and receives basic services.

She has a store in her home that she manages on a permanent basis. Marisol already has an established customer base in the area. She sells basic necessities, as well as groceries, vegetables, meat, and beer.

Marisol is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can buy merchandise, such as groceries in bulk and novelty products, for her business so that she can increase her sales and generate more income.

She has the willingness and desire to move forward and continue growing her business. In addition, the people who know Marisol describe her as a hardworking and responsible person who is of sound character.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fernando Augusto

texts.es: Fernando vive en el barrio Carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí tiene una tienda, donde vende al detalle, ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, enlatados y refrescos y otros alimentos que consumen las familias en su dieta diaria. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa a quienes les vende de contado y maneja también algunos créditos, que recupera semanalmente. Fernando es un buen padre de familia que vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 5 años. Su experiencia en esta actividad es muy tradicional en su familia, pues desde los 8 años, cuando llegó a la costa caribe, su padre fue su ejemplo en esta actividad comercial y esta es la experiencia que lo llevó a emprender su propio negocio, para de manera independiente tener oportunidades de ingresos;  aunque también trabajó en la construcción, posteriormente y con el producto de su trabajo disciplinado y el apoyo del concuñado quien le facilitó de manera incondicional el poder adquirir mediante plazos su tienda, con la cual  inició su aventura de negocio,   generado ingresos y se siente muy entusiasmado en hacerla crecer.  Su meta más adelante es construir una segunda planta para adecuar su vivienda en ese espacio y  aumentar el bienestar de su familia . En la actualidad Fernando está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conel cual comprará viveres, abarrotes, enlatados en mayor cantidad, con los cual aumentará su capital de trabajo y mantendria un stock de los productos que rotan rapidamente y que muchas veces sus clientes no encuentran.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla. There he has a retail store where he sells snacks, groceries, canned goods, soft drinks, and other foods that families consume as part of their daily diet. His main customers are housewives who pay with cash, but some will ask for credit and then repay on a weekly basis. Fernando is a good father. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 1 and 5. His experience in running this business is a family tradition. When Fernando was 8 years old, his family arrived from the Caribbean coast. His father was his example and the inspiration that led him to start his own business, work independently, and create opportunities to earn an income. Fernando previously worked in construction, which provided him the discipline needed to run a business. With the unconditional support of his wife, he was able to acquire the means to open his store. By starting this business, Fernando now has a source of income and is very excited about being able to grow. His goal moving forward is to build a second floor to his home so that he can have more space to provide for the well-being of his family.

At the moment, Fernando is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy food, groceries, and canned goods in large quantities. This will increase his operating capital and help him maintain an inventory of products that have quick turnover. Often times, his customers are not able to find these products.

loans.use: to purchase food, groceries, and canned goods in large quantities.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child.  His child is not currently in school. John has a boutique that sells clothes which he has had for one year. He has a barber shop as his second business. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, John hopes to add more stock to his business. John is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 37  años de edad, el es casado, cuenta con casa propia y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Caserío Finca Cassinelli, ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Mochumi, en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Ángel se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de pescado, el cual distribuye recorriendo en un burro. Angel tiene bastante tiempo dedicándose a este negocio, experiencia que le ha permitido obtener clientela fija para sus negocio, el vende al contado y al crédito según sea el caso y adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales.

Ángel esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de pescado en mayores cantidades y alimento balanceado para sus animales para que estos puedan tener un mejor desarrollo y pueda venderlos aun mejor precio.,

Ángel ha demostrado ser responsable y puntual, se caracteriza por tener buenos ánimos y muchas ganas de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ángel is 37 years old, married, and owns a home where he lives with his three dependent children. He resides in Caserío Finca Cassinelli, which is 25 minutes away from the city of Mochumi in the Department of Lambayeque.

Ángel sells fish as a traveling vendor. He distributes his product by riding around on a donkey. Ángel has plenty of time to devote to this business and has the experience necessary to build an established customer base. He sells for cash and on credit according to each customer. In addition, he engages in farming and raising animals.

Ángel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN to invest in his business. He will use the money to buy fish in large quantities and balanced feed for his animals so that they will develop properly and be sold at a good price.

Ángel has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual. He is known for having a good attitude and the desire to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of his children are currently in school. Jackson has a small retail shop that sells sugar which he has had for three years. He does farming as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Jackson hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Jackson hopes to expand his business. Jackson is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by expanding his business and increasing his sales with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es madre de dos niños de 12 y 07 años con quienes vive junto a su esposo en casa de su hermana. Delia tiene como trabajo la confección de sus propios diseños de ropa en lycra (ropas interiores, pantalones, blusas) de esa manera formó su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en casa de su hermana. Cuenta que hace tiempo ella era trabajadora de una señor que distribuía en un centro comercial llamado “El Huequito de la Ciudad”, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños ya que es muy buena en lo que hace, eso se refleja cuando vende todos los días. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios. Además de disponer de su tiempo, esta muy contenta con los créditos obtenidos en MFP por que dice que son muy bajos en cuanto al interés. Le gustaría mas adelante poder tener un taller mas amplio y poder contratar a alguna persona que le pueda ayudar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de todos para implementar su taller con maquinas como remalladoras y de coser. En esta oportunidad ella quisiera comprar una maquina y materiales para seguir con la  confección de prendas intimas.
texts.en: Delia is 28 years old.  She is a hard working and very responsible woman who is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 7 years old.  They live together with her husband in her sister's house.  Delia's work is designing and making her own clothing out of Lycra (undergarments, pants, blouses).  She has started a small but very productive workshop in her sister's house.  She tell us that some time ago she worked for a man who was a distributor in a commercial center called “El Huequito de la Ciudad” (The Little Hollow in the City).  However, over time she realized that she could make her own designs, as she is very good at what she does.  This is reflected in her daily sales.  What she likes most about her work is the money flow, which generates income every day.  In addition, she has time at her disposal.  Delia is very happy with the loans she has gotten from MFP because she says that they have a very low interest rate. Delia would like, in the future, to have a bigger workshop and to contract another worker.  This is Delia's second loan with MFP.  She is awaiting more support to be able to set up her workshop with sewing machines and sergers.  With this loan, Delia would like to purchase a sewing machine and materials so she can continue making undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and Lycra.

loans.name: Aston

texts.en:
Aston is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. One of his children is currently in school. Aston has a business selling clothes, which he has had for four years.

To help expand his business, Aston has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Aston hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Aston hopes to expand his business. Aston is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him increase his stock.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y una hija de 28 años de edad, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura, su padre le enseño desde muy joven esta actividad, actualmente a sembrado maíz para lo que está solicitando un préstamo que le cubra el gasto que realizara en abono.
Dicho préstamo le ayudara a tener los recursos necesarios para poder suministrarlos al cultivo, permitiéndole fortalecer la plantación de maíz.
Su objetivo es obtener una buena cosecha, para darle a su familia la alimentación necesaria así mismo comercializar una parte para tener entradas de dinero.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and a 28 year old daughter.  They have their own home.  José makes his living in agriculture.  His father taught him the trade when he was very young.  Currently, he grows corn, which is why he is requesting the loan, to cover to cost of fertilizer.
This loan will help him to have the necessary resources to apply the fertilizer to his crop, allowing him to strengthen his corn crop.
José's objective is to have a good crop in order to feed his family and to sell some to bring in money.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Kurusumu

texts.en:
Kurusumu is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Kurusumu has a beauty salon, which she has had for two years. She does farming as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Kurusumu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Kurusumu hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Kurusumu hopes to expand her business. Kurusumu is a member of BRAC small enterprise program which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Beth has a small retail shop, which she has had for five years. She is a teacher by profession.

To help expand her business, Beth has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Beth hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Beth hopes to expand her business. Beth is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Prossy has had a business selling phone accessories for two years.  She has rental houses as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase phone accessories for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Prossy hopes to own another business like selling clothes.  Prossy is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to run a business on her own.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  She is divorced and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Mary has had a bar business for two years.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soda and beers for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits to pay for the electricity bills and buy a fridge.  In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business. Mary is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her know how to be hard working.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child who is not currently in school.  David has had a barber salon for one year. He sells local brew as his second business.  

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase machines for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, David hopes to establish a bar in town.  David is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program (SEP), which has helped him earn a living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase machines for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Jose Abdubar

texts.es:
José, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 10 meses de nacida, él es agricultor y actualmente tiene una siembra de maíz en 2 manzanas de terreno.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlos al cultivo, ya que es bastante el terreno, también deberá pagar mano de obra, para que le ayuden a realizar la tarea.
Su objetivo es que a través del financiamiento pueda pagar los insumos necesarios y la mano de obra, para poder fortalecer el cultivo y recibir al final una buena cosecha para comercializarla.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old.  He lives with his wife and their 10 month old daughter.  José is a farmer and he currently has corn planted on 2 blocks of land. 
José is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers to apply to his crop.  Since he has quite a bit of land, he will need to pay laborers to help him with the work.
José's objective is to use the financing to pay for his necessary supplies and for labor in order to strengthen his crop and get a good crop to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply to his crop.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children.  One of his children is currently in school.  Frank has had a poultry farm business for three years.  He has rental houses as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase poultry feed for the chickens he sells.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Frank hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child.  In the future, Frank hopes to own a retail shop.  Frank is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program (SEP), program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business. That has helped him prosper in his life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Elena Graciela

texts.es:
Elena Graciela tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus hijos de 21, 15 y 7 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Elena  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su producción  y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Elena Graciela is 45 years old, single, and lives with her children (ages 21, 15, and 7) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Elena is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies at Briones Agrochemicals and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn. She will buy composts and supplies for her crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in her farming activities. The challenges she faces include diseases that could impact her crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). Her dream is to expand production so that her children can get ahead.

Elena enjoys completing her household chores.

loans.use: to purchase compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Yasinta

texts.en:
Yasinta is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Yasinta has had a small retail shop for one year that sells sugar.         
	
To help expand her business, Yasinta has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yasinta hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Yasinta hopes to expand her business. Yasinta is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program, (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda.  He is single and has two children. Neither of his children is currently in school.  John has had a small retail shop for five years that sells plates and plastic baskets.  He does farming as his second business.  
	
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase plastic baskets and saucepans for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, John hopes to expand his business. John is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program, (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by solving his financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase plastic baskets and saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school. Yusuf has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for one year.  He has a butcher shop as his second business.  
	
To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yusuf hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Yusuf hopes to expand his business.  Yusuf is a member of BRAC’s enterprise program (SEP), program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him solve his financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un padre D. familia D. 32 años D. edad,es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el cuenta con casa propia L. cual esta ubicada en L. zona urbano marginal del distrito D. Lambayeque, cuenta con servicios D.  luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 100  familias.

Julio se e dedica  a L. agricultura desD. hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras D. cultivo donD.  siembra arroz; una vez que se da L. cosecha lo venD. en los mercados D. L. zona, es un producto muy rentable, al cual se dedica desD. varios años, adicionalmente en su tiempo libre ofrece el servicio D. transporte publico D. pasajeros en una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas) , esta actividad L. realiza desD. hace 6 meses, el mayormente realiza esta actividad cerca a L. zona por donD. vive,

Julio ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles para L. compra D. fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras D. cultivo y asegurarse D. tener una muy buena producción D. arroz y para el pago D. mano D. obra para las personas que le ayudan y también necesita hacer los tramites para L.  renovación D. su licencia D. conducir.

Julio es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Julio is a 32-year-old father, married, and has two children. He owns a home in a marginalized urban area in the District of Lambayeque. Julio receives electricity. This small community has approximately 100 families.

Julio has been farming for some time. He has his own land on which he grows rice. When his crop is ready to harvest, he sells it at the local markets. Rice is a very profitable crop and he has been farming for several years. In addition, Julio offers public transportation services in his free time. He transports passengers using a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin for carrying people). Julio started this business six months ago and most of his business takes place near the area where he lives.

Julio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to apply on his farmland. This will assure him of good rice production. In addition, he will pay workers to assist him and renew his driver’s license.

Julio is a responsible and hardworking individual whose only wish is to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay his workers, and renew his driver's license.

loans.name: Janina Graciela

texts.es:
Janina Graciela tiene 21 años edad, es soltera vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia D. los Ríos. 

Los miembros D. la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas D. ciclo corto como siembra D. maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Janina  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra D. maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los venD. en el mercado mayorista D. Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra D. abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá D. apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su producción  y poder culminar sus estudios. 

Le gusta estudiar.
texts.en:
Janina Graciela is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Janina is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies at Briones Agrochemicals and sells her products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

The loan she is requesting will be used for planting corn. She will buy composts and supplies for her crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in her farming activities. The challenges she faces incluD. diseases that could impact her crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). Her dreams incluD. increasing her production and being able to complete her studies.

Janina enjoys studying.

loans.use: to purchase compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Maryleny

texts.es: Maryleny tiene 33 años, vive en casa propia, es conviviente y vive junto a sus tres hijos y su pareja con quienes realizan las actividades del hogar. Cuatro veces por semana Maryleny se dirige a su chacra, que esta ubicado en el sector de la hoyada, un puerto de botes que se inunda en época de lluvias, pero en temporada de verano se convierte en una playa y ahí se puede realizar sembríos. Lleva ya tres años con este trabajo y lo realiza a lado de su conviviente. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues considera que es bueno no ser dependiente de alguien, además puede disponer de tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades. Ahora planea instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que espera poder pagar todo a tiempo ya que siempre se consideró una mujer responsable. Con el dinero que solicito, comprará semillas de verduras para sembrarlas.
texts.en: Maryleny is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their three children.  Together, they all take care of their home.  Four times a week Maryleny heads to her small farm, which is located in the La Hoyada district.  The district is a port that floods in the rainy season but has beach in the summers.  That is where they have their farmland.  Maryleny has been doing this work for three years.  She works together with her partner.  Maryleny likes her work a lot because she thinks it is good to not be dependent on anyone.  In addition, she can take advantage of her extra time to do other things.  She is planning to open a small grocery store in her home.  This is Maryleny's second time requesting a loan from MFP.  She hopes to be able to make all of her payments on time, as she has always considered herself to be a responsible woman.  With the requested money, Maryleny will buy vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Arleth

texts.es: Arleth de 27 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 meses a 11 años de edad, allí se dedica a una actividad comercial, pues vende todo tipo  de colonias, perfumes, suéteres, bermudas y   dulces en general, actividad que complementa con la venta de minutos en su casa ubicada en el barrio villa Carmen; estas actividades   le generan un ingreso importante para apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Tiene su clientela fija  en la ciudad de Barranquilla, ellos le hacen sus pedidos telefónicamente o cuando ella realiza su preventa. Las compras las efectúa donde sus proveedores cada 8 días y cobra su cartera cada 8, 15 y 30 días máximo. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en esta actividad que inició cuando quedó desempleada, tocó muchas puertas para trabajar, pero no encontró opciones, así que decidida emprendió un negocio, con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. Inicialmente acudió a préstamos de alto costo, con personas que le ofrecieron créditos informales, aunque ganó muy poco, esta fue su primera experiencia y con ello construyó su principal clientela, pagó todo sus deudas y continuó poco a poco; su mayor desafío es no tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes de manera oportuna; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará accesorios femeninos e infantil, productos de dulcería y galletería en general , que son los productos que presentan mayor rotación en sus ventas.  Su meta es llegar a ser una profesional, pues en la actualidad estudia auxiliar de odontología y tiene el sueño de convertirse en una persona exitosa y esta es su prioridad. Sus utilidades son no menores del 50% y reinvirtiéndolas, reconoce que saldrá adelante.  Arleth  espera que la inversión en inventarios se incremente con su crédito para mantener un stock del mismo,  su negocio tiene  infraestructura física pequeña pero apropiada, sus proveedores dan buenas referencias  de Arleth por el buen manejo de sus relaciones comerciales, lo mismo que sus vecinos quienes aprecian su persistente trabajo  y esto habla muy bien de su personalidad y forma de conducirse en sus nichos de mercado como persona y como empresaria de la microempresa.
texts.en:
Arleth is 27 years old and resides in the town of Soledad, which is 15 minutes away from the city of Barranquilla. She lives with her husband and their three children who range in age from 11 months to 11 years. She has a retail business selling all types of colognes, perfumes, sweaters, Bermuda shorts, and sweets. This complements her other business of selling phone minutes from her home in the neighborhood of Villa Carmen. These activities generate vital income to support the well-being of her family. Arleth has an established customer base in the city of Barranquilla who submit their orders by telephone or whenever she comes to visit them. She buys the merchandise from her distributors every eight days and pays her bills every 8, 15, or 30 days maximum. Arleth has four years of experience in this business. She started when she became unemployed. Arleth had knocked on many doors to find work, but encountered very few options. Therefore, she decided to start a business so that she could move her family forward. Initially she accessed high-cost loans from informal moneylenders. Even though she earned very little, Arleth was able to use her first experiences to build up her main customer base. She continued to pay all of her debts and make gradual progress.

Her greatest challenge is not having enough operating capital so that she can fulfill the orders from her customers in a timely manner. For this reason, she is accessing a Kiva loan, which is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Arleth will use the funds to buy women’s and infants’ accessories, as well as sweets and cookies, since these products have high sales turnover. Her dream is to become a professional, since she is currently studying to become a dental assistant. Arleth’s dream is to become a successful person, so this is her main priority.

Her profits are no less than 50% and reinvested into her business so that she can continue moving forward. Arleth hopes to use her loan to invest in more inventory so that she can maintain her stock at an even level. The physical infrastructure of her business is small, but adequate. Arleth’s distributors have given her good references so that she can continue to manage her business relationships. Likewise, her neighbors appreciate the persistence in her work and speak highly of her personality and the way she conducts herself in the market as an individual and as a small entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase women's and infants' accessories, sweets, and cookies.

loans.name: Cesar Willian

texts.es:
Cesar Willian tiene 37 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 17 y 4 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agripac y Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cesar Willian is 37 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children (ages 17 and 4) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Cesar is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys his supplies at AGRIPAC and El Copa Agrochemicals and then sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan for growing corn. He will buy composts and supplies for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in his farming activities. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). His dream is to buy a plot of land.

Cesar enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Robina has had a small hotel (restaurant) for three years.  She does handcrafts as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase warmers for warming her food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Robina hopes to own a poultry farm. Robina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her handle the installments.

loans.use: to purchase warmers for warming the food for resale.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel tiene 56 años esta vive con su pareja la señora Victoria, juntos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que están a su cargo , el señor Angel ya es divorciado lamentablemente se divorcio de su esposa con quien compartió mas de 20 años de casada, el problema fue que su esposa le fue infiel mientras ella trabajaba en el exterior, pero la vida le dio otra oportunidad y volvió a formar una familia ,  Angel vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba , su principal actividad económica es el alquiler de volqueta a una empresa minera , dicha actividad lo realiza personalmente , es su única actividad para el sustento de su familia .
El destino del crédito es la reparación de su volqueta ,  la reparación es en el motor ya que mientras trabajaba tuvo problemas , entre sus sueños y metas esta renovar otra volqueta nueva para seguir trabajando y de esa manera seguir manteniendo a su familia y seguir adelante con su nueva vida dejando atrás aquella mala experiencia que vivio con su anterior mujer.
texts.en:
Angel is 56 years old. He lives with his partner Victoria. Together they have 2 small children who are dependent on him. Angel is divorced; unfortunately, he was divorced from his wife with whom he shared more than 20 years of marriage. The problem was that his wife was unfaithful when she was working abroad. However, life gave him another opportunity and he was able to form a new family. Angel lives in the city of Cochabamba. His main economic activity is renting his truck to a mining company. This is his only activity to support his family. 

The loan will be used to repair his truck. The repair is needed in the motor, because it had problems while it was working. Among his dreams and goals is renovating an additional truck so that he can keep working, and thus keep maintaining his family and getting ahead with his new life, leaving behind the bad experience he went through with his previous wife.

loans.use: to repair his truck's motor.

loans.name: Amador Felipe

texts.es:
Amador Felipe tiene 55 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Amador se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es trabajar con capital propio. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Amador Felipe is 55 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his 13-year-old child in the Ventanas canton of the De Los Ríos province.

The members of the Jesus Nos Ama comunal bank are located in the precinct of Los Amarillos in the canton of Ventanas. This communal bank focuses on short cycle agriculture such as the planting of corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Amador makes a living in agriculture sowing corn, rice and pigeon peas. He purchases his products at Agroquímicos El Copa and sells his produce at the Ventanas wholesale market. 

He is requesting a loan to sow corn and purchase manure and supplies for his crops. The loan will help him by supplementing his financial needs and improve his agricultural business. He faces challenges such as crop diseases like red stripe in the corn. His dream is to work with his own capital. 

He likes sports.

loans.use: to sow corn and purchase manure and supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Julia madre soltera, su único hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, construir por completo su vivienda es plan para a corto y largo plazo, tiene su propio negocio desde hace un tiempo teniendo la experiencia necesaria  en la aria del comercio. Iniciándolo con fondos de financiamientos. Que con el tiempo han ido poco a poco generando la ganancia siendo utilizada en el proyecto. 
Con el préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabones, papel higiénico, detergentes, carnes de res, pollo, embutidos, lácteos, artículos enlatados, artículos del hogar, entre otros productos. 
Obtenido  beneficio de aumentar sus ventas y generales ganancias continuando con el mejoramiento de su vivienda y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a single mother. Her only son works and has helped her financially to build her house. Her long and short term plans are to have her own business. She has the necessary experience in the business and will start it with her own funds. Over time, little by little she has made the money being used in the project. 

With the loan she is asking for, she will invest in buying product such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, toilet paper, detergent, beef, chicken, cold cuts, dairy products, canned goods, household items and more. 

With this benefit, she will increase her sales and general earnings and continue improving her home and her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet‘s group is comprised of four hard working women. Juliet is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school.  Juliet has had a cosmetic shop business that sells body lotions for seven years.         

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chemicals for making the body lotions for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business. Juliet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to make body lotions for resale.

loans.name: Erwin Daniel

texts.es:
Erwin Daniel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Erwin  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su producción e incrementar sus ganancias. 

Le gusta estudiar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Erwin Daniel is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and brothers in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. 

The members of the JESUS NOS AMA [Jesus Loves Us] community bank are located in the community of Los Amarillos, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank works with short cycle agricultural work such as planting corn, rice and gandul beans.

Erwin grows corn, rice and gandul beans. He buys his materials in Agroquímicos El Copa and sells his products in the wholesale market of Ventanas.
 
He is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy fertilizer and materials for the crops. The loan will serve as support to meet his financial needs and improve his farming activities as well as face challenges such as crop diseases like the "red ribbon" in the corn. His dream is to grow production and increase his earnings.  

He likes to study and play sports.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy fertilizer and ingredients for his crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Mary has had a beauty salon business for over 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Mary hopes to expand her business. Mary is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María Aracely tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como los cambios climáticos inesperados que afectan a sus cultivos. Su sueño es ampliar su producción y trabajar con capital propio. 

Le gusta en sus tiempos libres vender productos de Yanbal.
texts.en:
María Aracely is 32 years old. She is single and lives with her children in the  Ventanas canton in the Los Rios Province. 

The members of the JESUS NOS AMA [Jesus Loves Us] community bank are located in the community of Los Amarillos, which belongs to the  Ventanas canton. This bank works with short cycle agriculture crops such as corn, rice, and gandul beans. 

María works planting corn, rice and gandul beans. She buys her materials at Agroquímicos El Copa and sells them in the wholesale market of Ventanas.
 
She is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy fertilizer and materials for her crops. The loan will be used to support her financial needs and to improve her farming activities and face challenges such as unexpected weather changes that can affect her crops. Her dream is to grow production and work with her own capital. 

She likes to sell Yanbal products in her free time.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy fertilizer and materials for her crops.

loans.name: Armando Rigoberto

texts.es:
Armando Rigoberto  tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Armando  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta estudiar y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Armando Rigoberto is 30, married, and lives with his wife and son in Ventanas, Ríos Province.  He works in agriculture and grows corn, rice and gandul beans.  He buys products from Agroquímicos Briones and sells them on the local wholesale market.  The local communal lender is called "Jesus Nos Ama," in Recinto Los Amarillos, Ventanas, and many members are farmers, growing cash crops such as corn, rice and beans.  Armando  seeks this credit in order to plant corn and to buy needed fertilizer, which will help him increase production and profits. His farm is challenged by crop diseases such as corn rust among others. Armando enjoys sports and studying, and dreams one day of buying his own property.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy crop fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y a sus tres menores hijos con quienes comparte sus alegrías y logros. Rosa se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y al servicio de costura, ambas actividades lo realiza en su casa. Lleva cinco años en estos trabajaos, y menciona que la venta de medicina lo realiza en compañía de su esposo, quien la ayuda saliendo a venderlo en la calle. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede trabajar junto a su esposo y además que lo hace desde su casa, así puede disponer de su tiempo, tiene un amplio mercado y cada día aumentan más los clientes. En cuanto a su costura tiene clientes a diario pues hace un buen trabajo y siempre tiene personas esperándola para poder realizar una costura. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, se lleva bien con todos los de su grupo y es una de las socias más puntuales en el pago. Con el monto solicitado, comprará medicina natural al por mayor.
texts.en: Rosa is 35 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three young children with whom they share their happiness and successes. Rosa sells natural medicines and she is a seamstress. She does both businesses in her home. She has worked in these areas for five years. She mentions that sells the medicine with her husband who helps by going out to sell them on the street. What she likes about her work is that she can work with her husband. Also, she likes that she can work from her house and organize her time. She has an open market and every day she has more customers. As for her sewing business, she has customers daily. Therefore she does good work and she always has people waiting for her to finish her sewing. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She gets along well with her group and she is one of the most punctual members with her payments. With the requested loan, she will buy wholesale natural medicine.

loans.use: stock up on natural medicines.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever tiene 29 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un sector llamado Balsal, en el distrito de Cuervo , en el departamento de Cajamarca, este sector es pequeño , pero con muchas ganas de superarse y donde la mayoría de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ala ganadería.  

Ever se  dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización  de ganado vacuno hace  más de 03 años, tiempo que le a permitido adquirir experiencia en este rubro, Ever cria su ganado cerca de su domicilio y cuando estos tienen el tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
 
Ever esta  solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra  de ganado pequeño con su respectivo alimento balanceado , así como también pastos naturales que ayuden al engorde  y desarrollo de sus animales , para que los pueda vender a un mejor precio.

Ever es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con mucho esfuerzo desea que su familia se supere y que su hijo tenga otras y mejores oportunidades, para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Ever, 29, lives with his wife and small child.  He has his own house which is located in a neighborhood called Balsal, in the Cuervo district of the department of Cajamarca.  This neighborhood is small, but the residents have a desire to get ahead.  In this place, most of the people work in agriculture and livestock production.

Ever has had a business raising, fattening and selling dairy cows for more than 3 years, and over this time he has gained experience in this line of work.  Ever raises his cows near his house, and when they are at the ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.

Ever is requesting a loan of 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy young cows and nutritionally balanced feed.  He will also buy natural pasture grass that will help him to fatten and develop his animals, so that he can sell them at a better price.

Ever is a hardworking and responsible person who, with a lot of effort, hopes to see his family get ahead.  He also hopes that his child will have other and better opportunities for his development.

loans.use: to buy young animals and animal feed

loans.name: Emelide Maria

texts.es: Emelide  vende almuerzos especialmente sopas y comidas corrientes básicas  muy bien preparadas, a sus principales clientes que son los vecinos y peatones que diariamente circulan por su negocio ubicado en su propia casa. Las costumbres han cambiado y muchas personas no cocinan en su hogar,  sino que compran los deliciosos sancochos que prepara Emelide, los cuales  en pequeñas porciones,  pasan a ser los almuerzos de muchas familias, por lo económicos que son  y esto es un buen negocio de “yo gano tus ganas” para Emelide y su clientela. Emelide vende de contado diariamente y compra también diariamente para la venta del día a día. Con su negocio ha logrado ingresos importantes para apoyar la gestión de su hogar conformado con su cónyuge y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 30 y 37 años. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará insumos al por mayor, para la preparación de sus alimentos y utensilios de cocina, con los cuales ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorará el sistema de compras, accediendo a mejores precios por volúmenes; con sus créditos anteriores, se incrementó  ligeramente su capital de trabajo y aumentaron sus ingresos. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su vivienda en condiciones favorables para vivir más cómodamente. Mientras Emelide trabaja para conseguir su sueño  genera en su negocio una utilidad no menor del 20% que planea aumentar, en la medida en que su clientela continúe creciendo.
texts.en: Emelide sells lunches, specifically soups and basic fast food that is very well prepared.  Her main customers are her neighbors and the workers who daily go by her business, which is located in her own house.  Customs have changed and many people no longer cook in their home, but rather they buy small portions of the delicious stews that Emelide prepares.  This is the source of lunch for many families because it is economical, and so this business is a "win-win" situation for Emelide and her customers.  Emelide sells daily on a cash basis, and she also buys her ingredients each day for her daily sales.  With her business she has managed to generate an important income to help support her household, which is comprised of her husband and their two children aged 30 and 37.  Her Kiva loan is the 3rd loan that she has taken from the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use the loan to buy supplies at wholesale to make her food, and to buy cooking utensils.  This way she will offer better service to her customers and will improve her system of purchasing, as she will get better prices by buying in bulk.  With her previous loans, she increased her working capital a bit and increased her income.  Her goal for the future is to fix up her home to provide more comfortable living conditions.  While Emelide works to achieve her dream, her business generates profit no less than 20%, which she plans to increase as her customer base continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale to make her meals, and to buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es:
Elsa Isabel tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposo y su hijos de 15, 6 y 11 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Elsa Isabel, 35, is married and lives with her husband and kids who are 15, 11 and 6 in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

The members of the lending club "Jesus Nos Ama", located in the zone of Los Amarillos in Ventanas canton, work in short-cycle agriculture like planting corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Elsa is a farmer who plants corn, rice and pigeon peas. She buys her products from Briones Agrochemicals and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.
